07103.description: The event provides homeless veterans in the Newark and Northern New Jersey area with food, clothing, medical checkups, as well as housing, employment, and legal support. We need up to 50 volunteers to help us set up for the event and to help throughout the day with handing out items, offering assistance to elderly/disabled veterans, and clean up after the event. Volunteer sign-in will begin at 6am
07103.title: 2018 Neward Stand Down Volunteer

07103.description: Be a part of the Lights On program at West Side High School in Newark. This program keeps students engaged in activities so they are safe and off the streets. Volunteers ages 18 and older are needed each Friday night for activities ranging from art, sports, music, video and board games, beauty and fashion. Have another interest you would like to share? That would be great too! The program is from 6-10 pm and volunteers are needed for 6-8pm shift, 8-10 pm shift, or both.
07103.title: Lights On in Newark

07104.description: All The Way Up Adult Education Center is looking for volunteers to be apart of its team of tutors. Tutors teach in small group sessions to help students either prepare for their GED (HiSET) Exam, learn basic skills (Adult Basic Education) or learn English (English as a Second Language/ESL). ​ Be dependable and prompt Be able to commit to 10-12 sessions per semester Be able to relate well to a variety of people Be willing to maintain the confidentiality of the lessons; A college degree is encouraged, but not required (college students are encouraged to volunteer) Display good listening, speaking, reading, and writing skills Be flexible; Be friendly; Be patient; Be optimistic Have a good sense of humor FRINGE BENEFITS: Increased understanding and appreciation of different values, cultures, and lifestyles Increased skill in creative problem solving Sense of belonging to a group focused on a common goal Sense of accomplishment
07104.title: Tutor Adult Learners in Downtown Newark
07104.org: All The Way Up Adult Education Center

07104.description: Assist with planning and developing successful fundraising elements that can sustain the organizations progress. Attend monthly meetings.
07104.title: Fundraiser

07104.description: Will assist advocacy coordinator with strategic planning to share our mission with communities in and around New Jersey. Will be responsible for incorporating best accessibility practices for small and large meetings and events.
07104.title: Advocacy Advisor

07104.description: Have knowledge of trending website building components, graphic design, trouble shooting, branding, and IT.
07104.title: Website Designer and Developer

07104.description: Responsibilities include assisting board chairs with securing skilled volunteers for the purpose of event production, community outreach, and assisting blind and visually impaired attendees at workshops and events. Must have knowledge about interacting with people with disabilities.
07104.title: Volunteer Coordinator

07104.description: Oversee planning and production of small and large scale organization events and workshops.
07104.title: Event Planner

07104.description: Responsibilities will be to schedule, track, and report any support items for the success of the organization. Also, Board Secretary will be asked to assist board chairs with securing partnerships and speaking engagements.
07104.title: Board Secretary

07107.description: We are seeking volunteers for tutoring grades 4-8 at Sussex Avenue School. The tutoring sessions will take place during the after school program between the hours of 3pm-6pm Monday-Thursday. Volunteers should be passionate about working with young students and making an impact in their lives. We also ask that volunteers be prepared to commit to at least one day per week for the duration of at least one semester. Volunteers will need to pass a background check and attend an initial orientation for the program.
07107.title: Volunteers for After School Tutoring Program

07107.description: Here at Spread The Purple, Thanksgiving remains a time to help those struggling families prepare for their own holiday traditions with a Thanksgiving's Day food basket. Thanksgiving remains a time to help those struggling families prepare for their own holiday traditions with a Thanksgiving's Day food basket. Each family will receive a basket the following: * A Turkey or Ham * Box Potatoes * Canned Corn * Turkey Gravy * Carrots * Corn Bread or Croutons * Cranberry Sauce * Celery * Onions * Apples * Pumpkin Pie Mix * Pie Crust Mix * Non-Dairy Whipped Topping * Canned Vegetables Distribution of baskets will be held on Saturday, November 17, 2018. The scope of this event is as follows: To create the basket with the different donate food items Help set-up and decorate Regulate Sign-in sheets Greeters Distributing the Thanksgiving Basket to the community Pictures will be taken at the event. Also, Please provide your T-Shirt size? T-Shirts will be provided the day of the event.
07107.title: Thanksgiving Basket Event

10065.description: Dancing through College & Beyond (DTCB) is a unique nationwide event, attended by over 300 high school students and parents annually. Providing a much-needed service to college dance programs, and to high school students and their families, Dancing Through College & Beyond offers the opportunity to connect, one-on-one, with renowned faculty from colleges across the country. This event helps students fully explore college dance opportunities and assists them in navigating the college admissions process. This year, DTCB will be held at Hunter College: The City University of New York (695 Park Ave, New York, NY 10065). DTCB needs your help October 12th, 13th and 14th (Friday-Saturday)! If you are interested, please fill out this form with your availability and interest: https://goo.gl/forms/i6qIOuNsKgcuscq83 We need volunteers for: Setup and breakdown of the college fair and audition spaces Registration and coordination of auditions Directing attendees to the correct location/s Assisting during student and parent panels, college showcase performance, and auditions Available shifts: Tuesday, October 9th 11:30AM - 3:00 PM (Dancewave - 45 4th Ave, Brooklyn, NY) Friday, October 12th 3:00 PM - 7:30 PM (Hunter College) Saturday, October 13th 9:00 AM - 2:00 PM (Event Day - Hunter College) Saturday, October 13th 2:00 PM - 6:30 PM (Event Day - Hunter College) Sunday, October 14th 8:00 AM - 12:30 PM (Event Day - Hunter College) Sunday, October 14th 12:30 PM - 5:00 PM (Event Day - Hunter College) As a volunteer you will receive: A ticket to the college showcase performance on Saturday, October 14th at 6:30 PM. Entrance into the Careers in Dance Panel (if not volunteering during that time) or Sunday Panel. Our sincere appreciation for your participation in this unique event that facilitates over $3M in scholarships for dancers! Other Requirements: Ability to communicate with attendees, move and set up tables, prompt arrival for a shift. To find out more about DTCB, visit our website: wwww.dancewave.org/dtcb . DTCB is presented by Dancewave in partnership with Hunter College. Please contact Jenny Boissiere, DTCB coordinator at dancingthroughcollege@dancewave.org with any questions.
10065.title: Dancing Through College & Beyond 2018 Seeks Volunteers!

07660.description: JDRF One Walk is our flagship fundraising event and the largest type 1 diabetes event in the world. Join us as a volunteer to help JDRF create a fantastic, fun festival for our One Walk participants! The Role: Photographer: Arrive early to set up camera equipment. You will be taking staged team photos as well as candid photos of the walk throughout the day.
07660.title: Volunteer Photographer - JDRF One Walk, Overpeck Park

07660.description: JDRF One Walk is our flagship fundraising event and the largest type 1 diabetes event in the world. Join us as a volunteer to help JDRF create a fantastic, fun festival for our One Walk participants! Volunteer roles: Check-in Crew: Assist with early morning set up, volunteer check-in, T-shirt distribution or participant check-in. Cheer Crew: High energy volunteers needed to cheer on our participants as they start the walk and cross the finish line. Snack & Pack Crew: Assist with early morning set up, food and beverage set up and event breakdown. Volunteer shifts are available. Groups - such as Boy Scouts, Girl Scouts, school clubs and organizations, - are welcome to volunteer together.
07660.title: Volunteer at JDRF One Walk and help find a cure for T1D! Bergen County, NJ

07078.description: New Eyes for the Needy is seeking a member to serve on our Board of Trustees to advise and serve as legal counsel/guidance. The candidate must be able to attend our bimonthly meetings (Jan, Mar, May, June, Sept, Nov) in person and be available to offer legal counsel when needed throughout the year.
07078.title: Volunteer Board Member

07663.description: Volunteers needed to videotape speakers and interview guests at the Fall Dinner to benefit IES Brain Research Foundation. Volunteers will join us for the delicious dinner. If you cannot stay for the entire time, most important is volunteering the speakers from 5:45 - 7:15PM Volunteer should have a video camera or a camera that takes video or a phone that has good quality video sound and be able to put the videos on a CD or flash drive for us ASAP after the event. A bonus, but not necessary, if you are knowledgeable about editing videos, putting videos on You Tube, etc.
07663.title: Video Fall Dinner

07666.description: We are a non-profit organization looking for a volunteer to run a class of either Zumba or Yoga for seniors. Looking for either Wednesday mornings, Monday afternoons or anytime on Saturdays. But of course we can adapt our schedule to fit a different time that works better for you!
07666.title: Zumba or Yoga Instructor

10453.description: We are seeking 2 volunteers to assist with outreach during this event.
10453.title: Susan's Place Mammogram Van (Breast Cancer Awareness) Event

10452.description: Overview: South Bronx United is seeking coaches that not only want to share the joy of playing the sport but also want to reinforce the values that sport helps develop (teamwork, discipline, respect, etc) for its after-school soccer program. SBU, a sports-based youth development organization, runs after-school practices for boys and girls ages 6-14, 3 days a week. Coaches work with one age group of 10-20 youth for 2 hours at least one day a week. When: Tuesdays, Wednesday, and Thursday, 4-6pm Fall Season: Early September - Early November, Spring Season: Mid March-Mid June Where: Mullaly Park, Jerome Avenue at 165th St, Bronx NY 10452 Commitment: Coaches must be able to commit to being present for at least a 2 hours, one day a week (4-6pm on either Tuesdays, Wednesday or Thursdays) for one season. Qualifications: Previous coaching experiences are not required, but enthusiasm for working with children and background playing the sport is needed. Training: We will provide volunteers with orientation materials, coaching training, and a coaching manual. A formal orientation/ training will be held prior to each season. Benefits: In addition to helping provide the resources and support to allow underserved and under-resourced youth the opportunity to participate in a safe, structured environment, coaches will have opportunities for professional coaching training and will be connected to a network of caring volunteers for fun soccer related events throughout the year.
10452.title: After School Soccer Coach

08872.description: JOIN THE MOVEMENT TO PROTECT OUR CHILDREN: ATTEND OUR FALL TRAINING CLASS OCTOBER 16 - NOVEMBER 15TH, 6PM - 9:30PM, Monday and Thursday Evenings Court Appointed Special Advocates (CASA) is seeking volunteers to advocate for children who have been abused or neglected. On any given day, more than 350 children from Middlesex County are living in foster care. Now, more than ever, we need you. A child with a CASA is more likely to find a permanent home, spend less time in foster care, and perform better in school. Champion one of these children from your community and safeguard a child’s well being through advocacy in the court today. What does a CASA do? A CASA is integral in helping the Court in determining the appropriate permanent plan for the child. We ensure abuse and neglect doesn’t continue at the hand’s of the court. A CASA forges a connection with the child/children they are matched with. They build their trust and discover what their needs are. Once a month they visit with their assigned child. Advocates examine the child's health and education records and meet with their caregivers, school, therapists and other professionals. Once they identify what the child’s needs are, they write a report and advocate for a child’s needs in court. Our staff and peer coordinators are with you every step of the way to support you and help you succeed. No special skills or specific backgrounds are needed. Advocates must be able to commit to 18-24 months of service. Visit www.casaofmiddlesexcounty.org/volunteer for an application or call (732) 246.4449 or email info@casaofmiddlesexcounty.org
08872.title: Child Advocate:  Fall 2018 Training Class

08873.description: The Stein Hospice Team staff meeting is every Wednesday morning (most weeks) and we are in need of a receptionist to answer our phones during the meeting. Training, coffee or tea and snacks are provided. Come join our friendly group of compassionate caregivers!
08873.title: Stein Hospice Phone Receptionist Needed

10456.description: We are seeking 2 volunteers to assist with outreach during this event.
10456.title: Franklin's Breast Cancer Awareness Event

10455.description: We are seeking dedicated volunteers to provide tutoring and homework help to elementary and middle school students at our South Bronx community center. Masa's After-school Program operates on weekday evenings ( Mondays-Thursdays) from 6 PM-8PM. At the program, students receive homework help, grow as readers, learn how to set goals and achieve them, and engage in critical thinking about the world around them. Masa's 2018-2019 After-School Program (MAP) will start on September 12, 2018 and run through May 23, 2019. Volunteers are admitted on a rolling basis. Requirements are as follows: Ability to volunteer consistently for at least one of the following days: Monday (6 PM - 8 PM); Tuesday (6 PM - 8 PM); Wednesday (6 PM - 8 PM); or Thursday (6 PM - 8 PM). Able to commit to volunteering for all or most of the 2018-2019 academic year (college students who will leave NYC in May are still eligible to volunteer). When working with children, consistency is the key to success! Willingness and ability to serve as a tutor/homework facilitator to elementary or middle school students in an individual or small group setting. Willingness and ability to discuss topics related to social justice with students. These include discussing the Black Lives Matter movement, immigrant rights, the history of indigenous people in the Americas, and LGBTQIA rights. Attend mandatory Masa trainings and events (provided advance notice and multiple options for scheduling). Committed to following all Masa policies and procedures, including with respect to confidentiality Provide feedback on student progress and/or concerns to Masa staff. Interested in applying? Fill out our interest form. For more information you may also visit: www.masany.org or e-mail us at volunteeropportunities@masany.org
10455.title: A love for education grows in the Bronx!

10455.description: Masa is seeking dedicated volunteers who are interested in working as part of a team to help support our twelve-week Fall Robotics program in which Masa scholars hone their creativity and engineering skills by designing innovative robots with a focus on the local community. The Fall Robotics Program will end with an interactive showcase open to students and their families. Where: Masa South Bronx Community Center, easily accessible by the 2 and 5 trains to the 149th Street-3rd Avenue train station (just 2 stops into the Bronx) When: The Fall Robotics Program will begin on September 22 nd, 2018 and will end on December 15 th, 2018 Time: The Fall Robotics Program will operate on Saturdays from 1:00 pm - 3:30 pm. What: We are looking for dedicated volunteers to support our Robotics instructor. Volunteers will help facilitate daily lesson plans and activities, as well as help manage participating scholars. Prior background in STEM or Robotics is NOT required but a strong interest and knowledge of STEM subjects is highly welcomed. TRAINING will be provided. Requirements are as follows: Ability to volunteer on a weekly basis Attend a training which will take place prior to program start date Willingness to work with scholars in grades 4 to 6 (ages 9 to 12) Willing and able to help facilitate lesson plans to students, in small group settings, and under the leadership of our Robotics instructor Help manage behavior and lead scholars through daily instruction Attend fall interactive showcase Provide feedback on student progress and/or concerns to Masa staff Fill out volunteer application and interview with Masa staff
10455.title: Volunteer with a Fall Robotics Program!

10455.title: A love for education grows in the Bronx!

10455.description: We are seeking dedicated volunteers to provide tutoring and homework help to elementary and middle school students at our South Bronx community center. Masa's After-school Program operates on weekday evenings ( Mondays-Thursdays) from 6 PM-8PM. At the program, students receive homework help, grow as readers, learn how to set goals and achieve them, and engage in critical thinking about the world around them. Masa's 2018-2019 After-School Program (MAP) will start on September 12, 2018 and run through May 23, 2019. Volunteers are admitted on a rolling basis. Requirements are as follows: Ability to volunteer consistently for at least one of the following days: Monday (6 PM - 8 PM); Tuesday (6 PM - 8 PM); Wednesday (6 PM - 8 PM); or Thursday (6 PM - 8 PM). Able to commit to volunteering for all or most of the 2018-2019 academic year (college students who will leave NYC in May are still eligible to volunteer). When working with children, consistency is the key to success! Willingness and ability to serve as a tutor/homework facilitator to elementary or middle school students in an individual or small group setting. Willingness and ability to discuss topics related to social justice with students. These include discussing the Black Lives Matter movement, immigrant rights, the history of indigenous people in the Americas, and LGBTQIA rights. Attend mandatory Masa trainings and events (provided advance notice and multiple options for scheduling). Committed to following all Masa policies and procedures, including with respect to confidentiality Provide feedback on student progress and/or concerns to Masa staff. Interested in applying? Fill out our interest form. For more information you may also visit: www.masany.org or e-mail us at volunteeropportunities@masany.org

10455.title: Mentor Girls in the Foster Care & Juvenile Justice Systems

10012.description: Hello! We are a family-run charity English school based in China's Dragon City. If you're aiming to make a difference, travel or are taking a gap year then we might just be what you're looking for. We are searching for enthusiastic people to come and join us immediately as teachers. No experience as a teacher is required, just a positive attitude, a love for working with children and a desire to see more of the world! Through local funding we are excited to be able to provide 4 people from the US or UK paid volunteer positions and the chance to come and work with us for 6-12 months and really make a difference, not just in our local community, but all over the world through the work we do. We Provide: - 4 day working week, with 3 days off each week to travel China (we offer a weekly itinerary of different places to visit) - 4000rmb monthly allowance for travel and food - Free return flight home (or to your next adventure) for those who are able to stay for 12 months - Free Chinese lessons 4 times a week - Free use of school bikes and scooters - Accommodation with kitchen, bathroom, bedroom, wifi, electricity and gas bills all included - Provided meals on weekend days - Full teacher training - Invitations to random fun activities (BBQ's, Kayaking etc...) and visits to local towns and places of interest In return you'll be helping both the local and international English teaching community through a variety of jobs, including (but not limited to) teaching English classes, the creation of fun English speaking games, field trips, cooking classes, elderly home visits, community inclusion activities (free pancake offering on the street, line dancing with local \"aunties\", movie nights, story telling and much more!) and a whole host of other things! If you are interested please see our website www.dandaschool.com for more information or apply here with a copy of you CV, accompanied by a paragraph introducing yourself and explaining why you would like to come. Please add any questions you may have for us the application and we'll be happy to answer. We are looking for people to start before the school year begins (September 1st), as such, the interview process is quick with all initial successful applications given a Skype interview, with decisions made within a few days. Thank you so much for your time, please share on your Facebook or other social media if you think you have a friend who might be interested! Kind Regards, Dec & Any The D and A in D&A
10012.title: Want a Genuinely Wonderful China Experience? Join D&A Charity School and Become an English Teacher

08861.description: In this position the volunteer will provide the Palliative Care team with office support. Some of the task include entering program statistics into an excel spreadsheet, preparing paperwork for monthly committee meetings, making copies of journal articles and distributing the information to attendees. The volunteer will also prepare bereavement packets, and help with light filing.
08861.title: Palliative Care Clerical Volunteer

08861.description: This volunteer position will provide reception support to the Administrative suite. The receptionist will serve as a support person and is responsible for greeting visitors, patient, or clients, answer telephone calls, filing and other task as assigned.
08861.title: Volunteer Receptionist

08879.description: FALL BEACH SWEEP through Clean Ocean Action!! Help us clean the beaches at Raritan Bay Waterfront Park! We will be out in the sand clearing out any trash that has washed up on shore over the summer. This is one of our more popular events because it has one of the best views. We welcome people of all ages and even encourage groups to join our cause. This event will begin at 9am and go until 12pm. Do arrive early to sign our volunteer release form and to sign into the event! (You must be 18 years or older to sign the release form or have a legal guardian or parent do so for you.) We hope that you can come out and join us! If not go explore your county! ...And Don't Forget to TAKE A HIKE! http://www.middlesexcountynj.gov/About/ParksRecreation/Pages/PR/Take-A-Hike!.aspx ***All of our events are rain or shine! If we do cancel the event because of unsafe conditions, we will email all those who have registered with us.
08879.title: FALL BEACH SWEEP with Clean Ocean Action

10459.description: Volunteer with us as a community gardener this growing season from April though November. Help us plant and care for our vegetable and herb garden Distribute fresh produce at our Farm Stand during the summer months Participate in gardening activities such as cooking workshops No special skills required as we work and learn from each other. Saturdays * 11am to 2pm April 21 through November 17
10459.title: Dig • Grow • Eat • Engage

You will get to be part of an exciting season finishing event as our girls, mainly in grades 3-5 compete a 5K for the first time! We would welcome any person interested in helping out our no-profit capture the joy in the girls faces.
11549.title: Race Day Photographer
11549.org: GIRLS ON THE RUN LONG ISLAND INC

07060.description: Thank you for your interest in volunteering with Moms Helping Moms Foundation! The generous donation of your time helps us to serve more low income families in New Jersey. Warehouse volunteers assist with general tasks relating to incoming and outgoing donations. This includes but is not limited to sorting and organizing clothes, repackaging diapers, checking expiration dates on baby food and formula and packing bags for clients. We ask that you wear sneakers and comfortable work clothes for your shift. Please join us for an hour for the entire volunteer session. It's up to you. Our warehouse is located at 22 Howard Street (Back Building) in North Plainfield. Street parking is available, but please consult the street signs to confirm any parking restrictions. Please email volunteers@momshelpingmomsfoundation.org with any questions. SIGN UP HERE: http://signup.com/go/DMOYLmK
07060.title: Help kids in need by organizing donations in our warehouse

07505.description: The Workforce Development Program provides classes in Adult Basic Education/Special Needs (SOAR-ABE), High School Diploma Preparation and Testing, Vocational Culinary, as well as computer literacy and employable soft skills. The program also administers the WIOA Youth Program and the Breaking the Cycle Initiative. The WIOA-Youth Program (Workforce Investment and Opportunity Act) provides a high need population of young adults 16 to 24 years of age with High School Diploma preparation classes and onsite testing. The program also offers access to Next Step's vocational training programs in Energy Efficient Building Maintenance and Culinary Arts. The Breaking the Cycle Initiative provides court involved and formerly incarcerated individual’s transitional job training opportunities. Areas of focus include: Energy Efficient Building Maintenance and Culinary Arts. Site Supervisor Name Title Phone Fax, Email Quay Davis Case Manager Office#(973)232-1339 ext.304 Fax #(862)239-1037 qdavis@stpaulscdcnj.org Service Activities/Responsibilities: Complete weekly intake and assessments with clients using ETO software and orientation paperwork Manage a caseload of clients; monitor their progress toward meeting goals established in their service plans and their participation is required Maintain case management check-ins with clients in person and/or by phone to track their attendance record and program progress. Collaboratively with clients, provide assistance in goal setting and self-development; work as a team with other staff to achieve program wide participation, graduation and retention goals among others. Research and coordinate access to outside referral sources Organize and facilitate groups on various topics (Resilience, Critical Thinking, Collaboration, etc.). Maintain current, accurate, complete and timely documentation for programs progress in charts and databases Service Goals: Provide direct service to clients through case management Built healthy relationships with clients and other community organizations Assist clients with goal setting, time management, and organizational skills Collaborate with staff to collect data and documentation for program progress and reports Position Requirements/Qualifications Experience in human services, social work, educational, or related field Strong written and verbal communication Excellent organizational and interpersonal skills Problem solving and critical thinking skills Training and Evaluation Attend meetings, in-service and training sessions identified by SPCDC AmeriCorps Program and the SPCDC Next Step Workforce Development Program. Attend National Days of Service, AmeriCorps week, and events sponsored by the Corporation for National & Community Service. Expected Work Schedule: Monday -Friday 8:30am-4:30pm (flexibility can be offered but not guaranteed) Orientation Plan: Member will receive tour of agency and meet Next Step Staff. Orientation will also include two weeks of case management as well as office training which will consist of the next step weekly schedule, client orientation paperwork, ETO software, google drive (docs and sheets), and community resource guide. During this process the agency rules, guidelines, expectations, and dress code will also be discussed. Additional Info (parking, transportation, ID, etc.) Member will receive parking pass for the parking lot located on Smith St. & Veterans Pl. Other parking arrangements will be provided if needed ST. PAUL’S COMMUNITY DEVELOPMENT CORPORATION AMERICORPS PROGRAM BENEFITS AmeriCorps is the domestic version of the Peace Corps. AmeriCorps Members dedicate one year of their life to serve communities throughout the United States that are in need. For this year of dedication, individuals earn a living stipend, education award, and more! SPCDC AmeriCorps Members serve in all aspects of the agency's work. Duties range from working in the SPCDC Food Pantry, case management in our homeless men's shelter, and mentoring students in after school and summer programs throughout the City of Paterson, NJ. SPCDC offers its members different benefits based on a member’s level of commitment. *Full-Time Members commit to serve 1700 hours (approximately 35-40 hours per week). Position Type: Full-Time Volunteer Hours to Complete: 1700 Bi-weekly Financial Stipend: $528.15 Total Stipend Amount: $13,732.00 Educational Award: $5,920.00 *Access to NJSCNCS Trainings, Professional Development Workshops, & Access to AmeriCorps Alumni Resources *Participation in FREE End of the Year Trip to Washington D.C Contact AmeriCorps Program Director, Rachelle Thompson for more information at rthompson@stpaulscdcnj.org or (973) 710-3900 ext. 448
07505.title: Next Step Case Manager Aide (AmeriCorps)

07505.description: St. Paul’s Community Development Corporation - SPCDC Next Step Workforce Development Program Service Title: Teacher’s Aide Purpose: The purpose of this position is to assist the Next Step Workforce Development Program their comprehensive educational program encompassing career counseling, job development, job training, workforce development, adult basic education, and case management services. The program’s goal is to enhance their students’ academic skills so they can become self-sufficient and find gainful employment. This AmeriCorps position does not duplicate or displace staff of agency or service site. Service Responsibilities Include: Assist with the coordination of student appointments with outside resources Provide one-on-one tutorials for students in need Observe in classrooms to become familiar with classroom routines, textbooks and materials, and the main topics of major subjects taught Co-teach basic skills classes, and teach in the absence of the teacher using educational best practices Refer students to case managers for services and resources as needed Assist with the coordination and implementation of special events Assist in maintaining student classwork and homework assignments Training and Evaluation: Attend the St. Paul’s Community Development Corporation and SPCDC Next Step Workforce Development Program Meetings Attend meetings, in-service training sessions identified by SPCDC Next Step Workforce Development Program Assist evaluators in gathering information related to program improvement Attend National Days of Service, AmeriCorps week and events sponsored by the New Jersey Commission on National and Community Service. ST. PAUL’S COMMUNITY DEVELOPMENT CORPORATION AMERICORPS PROGRAM BENEFITS 2018-2019 AmeriCorps is the domestic version of the Peace Corps. Duties range from working in the SPCDC Food Pantry, case management in our homeless men's shelter, and mentoring students in after school and summer programs throughout the City of Paterson, NJ. SPCDC offers its members different benefits based on a member’s level of commitment. *Full-Time Members commit to serve 1700 hours (approximately 35-40 hours per week). 07505.title: Next Step Teacher Aide (AmeriCorps)

07501.description: We are organizing a team that will clean each panel and take photographs in preparation for the film on the mural and its impact in development. I need one team leader a co-team leader and those that just want to help call me and attend our 1st meeting SUNDAY SEPT 24th. Knapp mural is actually over 260 tiles. These tiles are in the museum a storage/exhibit. This temporary space is right off route 19 and 80 on Spruce street in Paterson. Plan now for the museum's cleaning of the mural's panels. We are archiving them for a documentary. The Bergen Museum's mural once hung on the Alexander's dept. store on route 4 and 17. It was created by Stefan Knapp and the museum needs volunteers to help clean the panels in preparation of a Knapp Mural Panel Exhibit. If you'd like to volunteer for assisting in gathering the cleaning material and be part of the prep program contact me.
07501.title: Week-ends Clean Stefan Knapp 260 Mural Panels
07501.org: Bergen Museum of Art and Science

07501.description: Site Name & Location Paterson Free Public Library (Danforth Memorial Library) 250 Broadway Paterson, NJ 07501 About Paterson Free Public Library The Paterson Free Public Library, New Jersey’s first public library, opens doors to ideas, discovery, knowledge and experiences to help people realize their dreams. To fulfill this promise, the Paterson Free Public Library will: Provide friendly and knowledgeable service; Provide facilities that foster community pride and identity; Meet the technology needs of our community; Collaborate and form partnerships with other community organizations; and, Support the educational, intellectual, cultural and informational needs of Paterson and Passaic County. Site Supervisor Name Title Phone Fax, Email Corey Fleming Library Director 973-321-1215 fleming@patersonpl.org Service Activities/Responsibilities: Provide general assistance to the public in various library departments Take active role in creating and implementing library programs Assist with preparation for Summer Reading Outreach Program - \"Libraries Rock\" Research options for measurement of effectiveness of programs and development tools Serve as substitute bookmobile staff Participate in library committees and teams Assist in answering patron inquiries and light computer help-desk requests. When needed, assist at public service desks duties as requested. Service Goals: 2,500 Paterson youth will receive literacy programming to combat the summer slide Youth participating in the programming will demonstrate increased literacy levels Paterson residents will be more aware of library services and resources To continue providing service and adapt to the changing needs of our customers Position Requirements/Qualifications Minimum of a H.S. diploma or equivalent, with higher education preferred Ability to communicate effectively, while speaking or writing An interest in the educational needs of children Driver’s license strongly preferred Training and Evaluation Attend meetings, in-service and training sessions identified by SPCDC AmeriCorps Program and Paterson Free Public Library Attend National Days of Service, AmeriCorps week, and events sponsored by the Corporation for National & Community Service ST. 07501.description: Service Title: Case Manager Aide (AmeriCorps) Program Site: Emergency Men’s Shelter/Partnerships for Healthy Living Reports to: Emergency Men’s Shelter Case/Manager Purpose: The AmeriCorps Case Manager Aide provides case management support to agency clients across all program areas (Food Pantry, Shelter, Next Step and Partnerships for Healthy Living). The Case Manager Aide works collaboratively with St. Paul’s CDC case managers and community-based organizations to provide comprehensive services to guide clients towards self-sufficiency. Service Responsibilities include: Provide comprehensive case management services including: intake assessment, service plan development, coordination of services and referrals, advocacy, crisis intervention, and program maintenance. Collaborate with other agency case managers for necessary case conferencing and in-house referrals. Complete and maintain detailed case files and statistical records including Bi- weekly progress notes, incident reports, program terminations, etc. Enter subsequent data into relevant data systems (i.e. ETO-Efforts To Outcomes, Social Solutions, Inc. and HMIS-Homeless Management Information System, United States Department of Housing and Urban Development) Establish and maintain linkages with other community based organizations and government agencies. Prepare progress reports weekly, monthly, quarterly, bi-annually and annually Perform other related duties as assigned. Compensation: Stipend Qualifications and Requirements College degree in social work, criminal justice or related social science field Significant clerical and file management experience and data processing Strong organizational skills and excellent verbal, writing and communication skills Understanding of socially relevant issues impacting low-income urban communities Computer literacy, including knowledge of Microsoft Office applications, internet, and email communications Valid Driver’s License is preferred, but not required ST. For this year of dedication, individuals earn a living stipend, education award, and more! SPCDC AmeriCorps Members serve in all aspects of the agency's work. Duties range from working in the SPCDC Food Pantry, case management in our homeless men's shelter, and mentoring students in after school and summer programs throughout the City of Paterson, NJ. SPCDC offers its members different benefits based on a member’s level of commitment. *Part Time Members commit to serve 900 hours within a year (approximately 20-25 hours per week). Position Type: Part-Time Volunteer Hours to Complete by 12/31/19: 900 Bi-weekly Financial Stipend (Without Taxes): $279.61 Total Stipend Amount for the Year: $7,270.00 Educational Award: $2,960.00 (after successful completion of service term) *Access to NJSCNCS Trainings, Professional Development Workshops, & Access to AmeriCorps Alumni Resources *Participation in FREE End of the Year Trip to Washington D.C Contact AmeriCorps Program Director, Rachelle Thompson for more information at rthompson@stpaulscdcnj.org or (973) 710-3900 ext. 448
07501.title: Food Pantry Driver (AMERICORPS)- Part Time

07501.description: AmeriCorps members assigned at this school site will assist with the supervision and coordination of in-school/after-school & summer programs at Community School 15 in order to provide academic support and enrichment opportunities for students in grades K-8. Under the supervision of the SPCDC Full Service Community School's Site Coordinator, service responsibilities will include: providing academic support services, chaperoning field trips, coordinating service-learning activities, as well as after-school and summer activities. Program Benefits : Education award upon successful completion of service , Training , Living Allowance , Childcare assistance if eligible , Health Coverage . SPCDC offers its members different benefits based on a member’s level of commitment. *Full-Time Members commit to serve 1700 hours (approximately 35-40 hours per week). *Part-Time Members commit to serve 900 hours (approximately 20-25 hours per week). Position Type: (2) Full-Time & (2) Part-Time Volunteer Hours to Complete: 1700 FT / 900 PT Bi-weekly Financial Stipend: $528.15 FT/ $279.61 PT Total Stipend Amount for the Service Year: $13,732.00 FT/ $ 7,270.00 PT Educational Award: $5,920.00 FT/ $2,960.00 PT *Access to NJSCNCS Trainings, Professional Development Workshops, & Access to AmeriCorps Alumni Resources *Participation in FREE End of the Year Trip to Washington D.C Terms : Permits attendance at school during off hours , Uniforms provided and required , Permits working at another job during off hours . Service Areas : Children/Youth , Education . Skills : Public Speaking , Youth Development , Leadership , Education , Writing/Editing , Counseling , Computers/Technology , General Skills , Team Work , Teaching/Tutoring , Conflict Resolution , Social Services , Fine Arts/Crafts . Service Description : Paterson Public School #15 (Kindergarten - 5th Grade) is a Full Service Community School within the Paterson Public Schools' Full Service Community Schools Initiative. Full-Service Community Schools provide comprehensive academic, social, and health services for students, students’ family members, and community members that will result in improved educational outcomes for children. These services may include: high-quality early learning programs and service; remedial education, aligned with academic supports and other enrichment activities, providing students with a comprehensive academic program; family engagement, including parental involvement, parent leadership, family literacy, and parent education programs; mentoring and other youth development programs; community service and service learning opportunities; programs that provide assistance to students who have been chronically absent, truant, suspended, or expelled; job training and career counseling services; nutrition services and physical activities; primary health and dental care; activities that improve access to and use of social service programs and programs that promote family financial stability; mental health services; and adult education, including instruction of adults in English as a second language. St. Paul’s Community Development Corporation (SPCDC) supports the initiative by providing comprehensive, developmentally appropriate, extended day/year academic enrichment, mentoring and community service opportunities to over 1,300 students at Full Service Community School 15 (FSCS15) and New Roberto Clemente Full Service Community Middle School (NRC). SPCDC also coordinates educational opportunities for school parents and makes other social services available inside the school building.
07501.title: School 15 Youth Program Assistant- (AMERICORPS)

11385.description: Welcome to D&A! We are a charity school based in China and we are looking for enthusiastic people to come and join us immediately as teachers. No experience as a teacher is required, just a positive attitude, a love for working with children and a desire to see more of the world! Through local funding we are excited to be able to provide 4 people from the US or UK paid volunteer positions and the chance to come and work with us for 6-12 months and really make a difference, not just in our local community, but all over the world through the work we do. We Provide: - 4 day working week, with 3 days off each week to travel China (we offer a weekly itinerary of different places to visit) - 4000rmb monthly allowance for travel and food - Free return flight home (or to your next adventure) for those who are able to stay for 12 months - Free Chinese lessons 4 times a week - Free use of school bikes and scooters - Accommodation with kitchen, bathroom, bedroom, wifi, electricity and gas bills all included - Provided meals on weekend days - Full teacher training - Invitations to random fun activities (BBQ's, Kayaking etc...) and visits to local towns and places of interest In return you'll be helping both the local and international English teaching community through a variety of jobs, including (but not limited to) teaching English classes, the creation of fun English speaking games, field trips, cooking classes, elderly home visits, community inclusion activities (free pancake offering on the street, line dancing with local \"aunties\", movie nights, story telling and much more!) and a whole host of other things! If you are interested please see our website www.dandaschool.com for more information or apply here with a copy of you CV, accompanied by a paragraph introducing yourself and explaining why you would like to come. Please add any questions you may have for us the application and we'll be happy to answer. We are looking for people to start before the school year begins (September 1st), as such, the interview process is quick with all initial successful applications given a Skype interview, with decisions made within a few days. Thank you so much for your time, please share on your Facebook or other social media if you think you have a friend who might be interested! Kind Regards, Dec & Any The D and A in D&A
11385.title: Paid Teaching Role for Charity School - Learn to Teach, Travel China and Make a Difference

07502.description: Epitome of Soul, Inc. is a non-profit organization focusing on arts education and cultural development. The Program Coordinator Volunteer position is an opportunity to grow, learn, network with a diversity of education professionals, and make a difference in rising students’ lives. The volunteer agreement will be approximately 10-15 hours per week for 8-12+ months. Responsibilities include and are not limited to: Planning and coordinating one or more programs for a non-profit organization, including fundraising, budgeting, and community outreach. Developing and implementing programs that align with the organization's mission and support the organization's goals. Creating program materials, establishing staffing requirements, and ensuring that program achieves set objectives. Managing the day-to-day operations for the Arts & Soul After-school Club (2 hours). May be responsible for special events that publicize the organization and its programs to the community. Typically requires a bachelor's degree. Typically requires 2 to 4 years of related experience. This position is voluntary and the organization has the right to 1) change the nature of the assignment based on programmatic needs and 2) terminate the volunteer agreement based on program changes, change in skill set needs, or other identified circumstances as in an \"at will\" environment.\" Take notice that the herein volunteer agreement does not constitute an employment relationship. All volunteers agreed to participate in the assigned programs without expectation of remuneration or any other form of compensation. Epitome of Soul reserves the right to terminate this agreement as set forth above. This document constitutes the complete understanding between the parties and all agreeing to be bound by the stated terms.
07502.title: Program Coordinator

06854.description: Family & Children's Agency is taking applications for the (2018-2019) school year for volunteers in the ASPIRE program. FCA is seeking individuals to make a difference in the lives of middle school and high school students by volunteering in FCA's ASPIRE after school program which started September 2018. Come join a dynamic team of committed volunteers who provide guidance and homework help at FCA's program located on the 3rd floor of Ben Franklin School from 3:30 to 5:30 p.m. during the academic year. No experience is necessary and volunteers can choose to volunteer one afternoon a week, Monday through Friday for a minimum of three months (academic year preferred). Adults and high school students are eligible for volunteering. Program Information Family & Children’s Agency seeks to improve the lives of Norwalk’s students by enabling their successful transition into high school and beyong while increasing their ability to be productive, independent young adults. This is accomplished by providing a safe and structured community-based After School Program for students to improve academic performance, develop character, and promote healthy peer interactions and lifestyles. The program operates on the Norwalk Public Schools' calendar and does not offer programs during holidays and vacations. Requirements To become a volunteer in the After School Program, volunteers must complete an application and necessary background checks, including criminal, state, and Department of Children and Families checks. Volunteers must also complete an Agency orientation with Volunteer Services and a program orientation with the After School Program staff. Family & Children’s Agency expects volunteers to commit to one afternoon a week for a minimum of three months. However, volunteers are encouraged to commit for the academic year. Many volunteers have seasonal activities or commitments and time off can be arranged to accommodate these activities. Skills Needed: Positive role model Desire to work with children Patience Good judgment Dependability/consistency Cultural sensitivity/awareness Ability to maintain appropriate boundaries Clean background check (for those over age 18) Family & Children’s Agency is a leading non-profit, human service organization that is committed to increasing the social and emotional well-being of our clients. We provide strength-based, solution focused services that respond to the individual needs of children, families, adults, and seniors. Last year more than 13,000 individuals of all ages and all walks of life experienced life-altering, positive changes as a result of their work with Family & Children’s Agency.
06854.title: After School Homework Helpers & Program Support Volunteers Needed!

06854.description: Help with Childcare Family & Children’s Agency offers an array of services through its Child and Family Development Programs. In general, these programs provide support, guidance, and classes for both mothers and fathers to develop effective parenting skills and to build a strong foundation for their families. Volunteers are always needed to watch young children while moms attend their Circle of Security group or their MOMS groups. We are always needing volunteers to provide childcare for infants and toddlers. FCA runs various groups throughout the year usually once a week in the morning. We look for one or two adults to watch the children for 2 to 2.5 hours once a week. Days/times vary depending on the specific group. The number of children also varies from week to week. Family & Children’s Agency is a leading non-profit, human service organization that is committed to increasing the social and emotional well-being of our clients. We provide strength-based, solution focused services that respond to the individual needs of children & families, youth, adults, and seniors. Last year more than 10,000 individuals of all ages and all walks of life experienced life-altering, positive changes as a result of their work with Family & Children’s Agency. Requirements Volunteers must have experience with young children and complete an application and background checks, including criminal, state, and Department of Children and Families checks. Volunteers participate 2 hours a week during morning hours. Fluency in Spanish is a plus. Volunteers must also complete an Agency orientation with Volunteer Services and a program orientation with their supervisor. Skills Needed: Love for young children Patience Good judgment Dependability/consistency Cultural sensitivity/awareness Ability to maintain appropriate boundaries Clean background check
06854.title: Morning Childcare

08541.description: Benefactor for Bates celebrates the legacy of Pearl Nelson Bates and raises funds for the scholarship program created in her honor. Pearl was a dedicated community leader and enthusiastic YWCA volunteer. When she died unexpectedly in 1963 following surgery, ETS colleagues sent a donation in her memory to the YWCA to be used for children’s camp. Sherman Bates, Pearl’s husband, recalled that, although she had no children of her own, \"Pearl considered everybody to be her child.\" By 1965, following group and individual contributions, the YWCA Board of Directors formally designated the Pearl Bates Scholarship Fund. Now in its fifty-second year, the Pearl Bates Scholarship Fund has helped hundreds of families access all the programs and services offered at the YWCA and has awarded over two million dollars in scholarships. Friends of the YWCA are partnering with ETS to honor Pearl Bates’ legacy, highlighting the programs and services her Scholarship Fund gives access to for community families who would otherwise be unable to afford. Special thanks to ETS and PNC Wealth Management for making our inaugural event possible. Each year, YWCA hosts its Benefactor for Bates. For one special evening, we request assistance for this exciting evening. Volunteer opportunities include photography, escorting, providing directions, checking in guests, setting décor, and assisting with event clean up. Volunteers are needed the following day and time: THURSDAY, NOVEMBER 15th, 2018: 3:00 PM - 7:00 PM If interested, please send an email with your name, phone number, and availability to volunteer(at)ywcaprinceton(dot)org Attn: Donnella Tilery, Assistant Director For more information on YWCA, please visit www.ywcaprinceton.org For more information on the 2018 Benefactors for Bates, please visit: https://www.ywcaprinceton.org/news-events/benefactors-for-bates/
08541.title: Event Volunteers Needed in Princeton, NJ for Benefactor for Bates Scholarships

08542.description: FUTURO is a mentoring program that supports and guides Latino high school students in their pursuit of higher education - most of them will be the first in their families to break the cycle of poverty and attend college. The program is open to first and second generation immigrants living in the City of Trenton that are in their Junior year of high school. The program mentors and tutors the students until HS graduation and follows up with an alumni network. To ensure the students will be able to keep up their grades (and therefore qualify for financial aid to help pay for college), we require that they attend weekly tutoring. We currently need volunteers to assist with the core academic class (English, Math, Sciences, and History). We also work to prepare the students for standardized testing such as the ACT and SAT. Tutoring is on Wednesdays evenings, 6pm-8pm at the Princeton Presbyterian Church. Please follow the link to our website and complete the application: http://laldef.org/volunteer-with-us/ and email us your resume to info@laldef.org
08542.title: Tutor Needed for High School Students
08542.org: Latin American Legal Defense and Education Fund

07052.description: Life is limited when you can't read medical label warnings, correspondence from your childrens' teachers, instructions on a new appliance, complete a job application, read a street sign, directions, or apply for a driver's license. Yet many adults find themselves in exactly that position, particularly here in Essex County, where one in every four adults is considered functionally illiterate in English, according to U.S. Department of Education data. When you help an adult, you help her or his entire family. At Literacy Volunteers of America, Essex & Passaic Counties, we have a long list of U.S. citizens and immigrants, among them refugees and asylum seekers, waiting for help in learning to speak, understand, read, and write in English. But we need volunteers to teach them. Here's how you can help: Become a volunteer literacy tutor by attending our 18-hour tutor training course at West Orange Public Library 46 Mount Pleasant Ave., West Orange, NJ, Wednesdays 6:00-9:00 p.m., October 10, 17, 24, 31, November 7 & 14, 2018. Volunteers work once per week for two hours or more and earn a certificate as tutors of Basic Literacy and English for Speakers of Other Languages from Literacy Volunteers of America (LVA), one of the largest non-profit adult literacy organizations in the country. And more than that, they help improve the lives of adults and their family members. For more information, please contact LVA at 973-566-6200, ext 225, via email emartin@lvaep.org, or register through our website www.lvaep.org.
07052.title: Become a trained literacy volunteer!
07052.org: Literacy Volunteers of America, Essex and Passaic Counties

11050.description: Gold Coast Long Island Take Steps Walk to Find Cures The Gold Coast Long Island Take Steps Walk is a family friendly community walk dedicated to raising awareness and mission-critical funds to support the Crohn's & Colitis Foundation. Since the Foundation's inception, volunteers have helped us raise $330 million towards breakthrough research, public and professional education, and patient support services in communities across the nation. Volunteers are the backbone to the Foundation. We are looking for volunteers to help at our walk on October 14th. Some volunteer opportunities at the walk could be: helping set-up the event, assisting checking our Take Steps participating in at registration, lending a hand in the kids zone area, distributing t-shirts and incentives, replenishing the food area, cheering on our participants who are walking the 1.5 miles on the route, clean up and more. Contact Melissa Pulsinelli at MPulsinelli@crohnscolitisfoundation.org or 516.222.5530 to volunteer or get more information. (Need volunteer hours for school? We’re happy to sign any forms!) Want to walk with your family? Register for the walk today! www.cctakesteps.org/goldcoastlongisland2018
11050.title: Volunteer at the Gold Coast Take Steps Walk
11050.org: Crohn's & Colitis Foundation of America, Long Island Chapter

11050.description: Gold Coast Long Island Take Steps Walk to Find Cures The Gold Coast Long Island Take Steps Walk is a family friendly community walk dedicated to raising awareness and mission-critical funds to support the Crohn's & Colitis Foundation. Since the Foundation's inception, volunteers have helped us raise $330 million towards breakthrough research, public and professional education, and patient support services in communities across the nation. Volunteers are the backbone to the Foundation. We are looking for volunteers to help at our walk on October 14th. Some volunteer opportunities at the walk could be: helping set-up the event, assisting checking our Take Steps participating in at registration, lending a hand in the kids zone area, distributing t-shirts and incentives, replenishing the food area, cheering on our participants who are walking the 1.5 miles on the route, clean up and more. Contact Melissa Pulsinelli at MPulsinelli@crohnscolitisfoundation.org or 516.222.5530 to volunteer or get more information. (Need volunteer hours for school? We’re happy to sign any forms!) Want to walk with your family? Register for the walk today! www.cctakesteps.org/goldcoastlongisland2018
11050.title: Volunteer at the Gold Coast Take Steps Walk
11050.org: Crohn's & Colitis Foundation of America, Long Island Chapter

11050.description: The Gold Coast Arts Center is an independent 501(c)(3) not-for-profit organization serving the Long Island and greater New York community for over 20 years and dedicated to promoting and supporting the arts through education, exhibition, performance and outreach. Since our founding in 1995, over 100,000 people of all ages and backgrounds have taken advantage of our many classes, live performances, programs, workshops, films and art exhibits. Every day we provide students, teachers, parents, senior citizens and community members with opportunities to learn about, discuss, view, enjoy, share and make art! Looking for volunteers to work the film festival from November 3-14 in towns from Great neck, Roslyn, Port Washington and Manhasset. You will help usher, take tickets, answer questions, and more. You will be standing on your feet and may be required to carry chairs.
11050.title: Gold Coast Film Festival Volunteers: Long Island

08807.description: Join us for a fun community event. We invite you dress as a super hero as you help us with crafts, games, activities, registration, organizing kids into activities, and handing our water and snacks. This is our second annual benefit for children with diabetes. All proceeds go to children who can't afford to go to diabetes camp.
08807.title: Super Hero Walk
08807.org: MICHAELS MIRACLES A NJ NONPROFIT CORPORATION

08807.description: The Arc Foundation of Somerset County will host its annual fundraiser - Arc Angel Ruby Reception & Casino Night Fundraiser on Friday, November 2, 2018, at the Bridgewater Marriott. This event is the major fundraiser to support The Arc of Somerset County's programs for individuals with intellectual and developmental disabilities. It is a fun-filled evening with entertainment. We are looking for an individual to take photos during the event. Photos to be taken will be discussed prior to the evening of the event. Photographer must use their own camera. This is a semi-formal event and volunteers need to wear appropriate attire (suit, skirt, dress, dress pants, etc.). Volunteers will be served dinner prior to the start of the event. For more information about the event, please go to: http://www.thearcofsomerset.org/events/arc_angel_gala.html.
08807.title: Event Photographer Needed

08807.description: The Arc Foundation of Somerset County will host its annual fundraiser - Arc Angel Ruby Reception & Casino Night Fundraiser on Friday, November 2, 2018, at the Bridgewater Marriott. This event is the major fundraiser to support The Arc of Somerset County's programs for individuals with intellectual and developmental disabilities. It is a fun-filled evening with entertainment. We are looking for individuals to volunteer the evening of the event to assist with check-in, guest relations, silent auction, etc. This is a semi-formal event and volunteers need to wear appropriate attire (suit, skirt, dress, dress pants, etc.). Volunteers will be served dinner prior to the start of the event, will be notified of their assignment/duties prior to the night of the event, and there will be a review of duties at the event prior to the event's start. For more information about the event, please go to: http://www.thearcofsomerset.org/events/arc_angel_gala.html.
08807.title: Volunteers Needed for Evening Fundraising Event

08807.description: The New Jersey Orators is a 33-year-old non-profit youth organization that teaches the art of public speaking, an appreciation for literature, reading and media arts literacy, college readiness, and life skills to youth from 7 to 18 years of age in preparation for college. Board members duties include: attendance at our monthly board meetings and year-end fundraiser. providing leadership and guidance to one of the seven committees of the board and to actively participate in committee work. playing an active role in identifying financial resources necessary for the New Jersey Orators to achieve its mission. expected to leverage personal relationships and connections to help the development committee and staff identify and solicit potential funders.
08807.title: Volunteer Non-Profit Board Member

08807.description: Your role as a \"New Jersey Orators Coach\" is critical to the success of our oratorical and reading literacy program. You are responsible for preparing Orator students in chapter locations to have confidence at all times when speaking or writing. We train all our NJO Coaches. Students learn from coaches the skills and techniques of public speaking and writing literacy. Responsibilities: Meet with students on a weekly basis to train them on developing public speaking techniques and literacy skills. Register and track students at an assigned chapter. Prepare students for community presentations and attendance at two annual statewide competitions with their peers.
08807.title: Teach confidence in speaking. Become a New Jersey Orators Coach

11021.description: The Village of Great Neck Plaza is seeking volunteers to assist on its Senior Span Program, which provides projects and programs for our senior citizens. We are looking for volunteers to \"Call a Friend,\" making contact with one of our shut in seniors for companionship and friendship. Other similar tasks need volunteers, such as helping a senior with an arts & craft project, reading poetry to seniors, assiting in errands, etc. There are also seminars held regularly at Village Hall. Each seminar is on a separate topic focusing on health, nutrition, aging issues, managing finances, and general senior education. Candidates must have professional expertise in an area and be comfortable with public speaking. For further information, please contact Mayor's Assistant, at (516) 482-4500, or mayorsassistant@greatneckplaza.net.
11021.title: Senior Span Volunteers

11102.description: volunteer with GOODWILL NYNJ AT THE NEW YORK CITY MARAThoN! On novemeber 4th, 100+ GOODWILL volunteers will BE GIVEN ACCESS to a UNIqUE behind-the-scences glimpse of the world’s largest race. DONATION BIN ATTENDANTS WILL play a KEY role IN GW’S EFFORTS TO collect CLOTHING DONATIONS FROM 50,000+ RUNNERS. At last year’s marathon, goodwill diverted THOUSANDS OF pounds of used goods from landfills in just one day. these valuable donations fuel goodwill’s mission to empower individuals with disabilites and other barriers to employment to gain independence through the power of work. see more details below and sign up today! TITLE NYC Marathon Goodwill Bin Attendants play an integral role in rescuing thousands of pounds of clothing from the starting lines of the world’s largest race. These donations provide critical resources for people with disabilities and other barriers to employment. PURPOSE/OBJECTIVE 50,000 runners will require gentle reminders, direction, and have questions about making a clothing donation in one of the 500+ bins placed throughout the race. As a Bin Attendant, you will represent Goodwill on the front lines. LOCATION Fort Wadsworth, Staten Island, NY. Bus pickups will be available. KEY RESPONSIBILITIES Answer questions from runners, ensure nothing is stolen from bins, ensure no trash enters bins and share the mission of Goodwill NYNJ with interested individuals. QUALIFICATIONS Ability to occupy a position for multiple hours, Confidence in communicating with strangers. TIME COMMITMENT Arrive no later than 5:30 am and stay until 12pm on November 4th. TRAINING/SUPPORT PROVIDED Attend 1 hour training webinar to go over logistics for the day and learn more about Goodwill NYNJ’s mission. BENEFITS Coffee and refreshments | Complimentary jacket and hat | Warm fuzzy feelings from giving back to your community To learn more or to express interest in volunteering, please email development@goodwillny.org or call Brian O’Neil, Director of Corporate Relations at 718.440.4378. volunteer with GOODWILL NYNJ AT THE NEW YORK CITY MARAThoN!
11102.title: Volunteer with Goodwill Industries NYNJ at the New York City Marathon!
11102.org: Goodwill Industries of Greater NY & Northern NJ, Inc.

11102.description: Are you a beauty enthusiast or a beauty professional? Would you like to donate an hour or more of your time to making seniors feel good? We are looking for people to donate an hour to do manicures on the seniors. We will provide all materials and take some pictures you can have as a keepsake! We have also recently lost our licensed person who did free haircuts. If interested please reply, asimmons@hanac.org. Saturday 10am-12:30 (brunch provided) Email me if you would like to help asimmons@hanac.org
11102.title: Manicures for seniors! Saturdays
11102.org: HANAC JVL Innovative Senior Center & HANAC Training and Employment

11101.description: Welcome to our ESL Practice Program at The English Language Center! The ESL Practice Program needs volunteers to assist our adult English language students with small group conversation practice or one-on-one writing tutoring Evening Writing Partners (one-on-two tutoring): Wednesdays and/or Thursdays, October 17 - December 6 5:45PM to 6:45PM 1 hour per week (7 weeks) Afternoon Conversation Groups: Tuesdays and Thursdays, October 2 - November 29 1:00PM to 2:00PM Afternoon Writing Partners: Mondays and Wednesdays, October 10 - November 29 1:00PM to 2:00PM The aim of Conversation Groups is to further our students' speaking and listening skills. Many of our students live with family or friends and don't get to practice these skills outside of class. Writing Partners, on the other hand, help individual students with homework from their writing and grammar classes as well as help students improve their overall writing skills. Writing tutors should be able to assist students with English grammar and punctuation, forming paragraphs, brainstorming for ideas, organizing their writing, and using tools like the dictionary and thesaurus. Volunteers are asked to commit only one hour per week, though we are happy to have you more often if you like. Our students are very motivated and fun to work with, and they are very appreciative of any help you can give. For more information, please email: Evening Sessions: Marek Pena at mpena@lagcc.cuny.edu Afternoon Sessions: Margaret Culhane at mculhane@lagcc.cuny.edu
11101.title: ESL tutors needed for conversation practice or writing
11101.org: The English Language Center at LaGuardia Community College

Afternoon Conversation Groups, October 2 - November 29: When: Tuesdays and Thursdays Time: 1:00pm to 2:00pm Afternoon Writing Partners, October 10 - November 29: When: Mondays and Wednesdays Time: 1:00pm to 2:00pm Evening Conversation Groups, October 10 - December 6: When: Wednesdays and Thursdays Time: 5:45pm to 6:45pm Evening Writing Partners, October 17 - December 6: When: Wednesdays and Thursdays Time: 5:45pm to 6:45pm The aim of Conversation Groups is to further our students' speaking and listening skills. Many of our students live with family or friends and don't get to practice these skills outside of class. Writing Partners, on the other hand, help individual students with homework from their writing and grammar classes as well as help students improve their overall writing skills. Volunteers are asked to commit only one hour per week, though we are happy to have you more often if you like. Our students are very motivated and fun to work with, and they are very appreciative of any help you can give. For more information, please email mculhane@lagcc.cuny.edu for afternoon sessions, and marpena@lagcc.cuny.edu for evening sessions.
11101.title: ESL tutors needed for conversation practice or writing
11101.org: ESL Practice Program at The English Language Center

11101.description: Each year, more than 75 runners from all over the country gather to run the TCS NYC Marathon in support of The Hole in the Wall Gang Camp! Join us as we support and thank our runners throughout race weekend! Volunteer opportunities are available at our pre-race dinner, start line and rockin’ cheer zone. There are opportunities for all ages!
11101.title: NYC Marathon
11101.org: The Hole in the Wall Gang Camp

11106.description: Energy Tech High School is launching a new mentoring program for our Year 13 and 14 students! We are looking for volunteer career mentors who are currently working within STEM fields, specifically in companies or organizations related to Engineering, Technology, Construction, and Architecture. As a mentor in this program you will be paired with college students who attend LaGuardia Community College working toward an associate degree in either Energy Technology or Engineering, with a focus in Mechanical or Electrical. The mentoring program is an integral component of the school’s commitment to connect what students learn in the classroom to the realities of the workplace. We believe mentoring helps students gain new skills and explore career options.
11106.title: Energy Tech High Career Mentor

11370.description: Responsible marketing persons to develop Power Point presentations for our charitable foundation Alert Inc. Please see our website : AlertNFP.com for more info
11370.title: Marketing Manager -Powerpoint Developer

11104.description: The Senior Center provides around 200 meals a day to seniors. Volunteers will provide assistance in the senior center dining room and kitchen for lunch service, which includes food preparation, distribution and clean up. WHAT WILL I BE DOING? Under the direction of the kitchen supervisor you might be: Wrapping silverware Preparing components of the meals Serving meals Providing table service Assisting with clean up Washing dishes/pots and pans Wiping down tables Signing in Seniors YOUR QUALITIES: Commitment and Consistent Considerate and patient Available Mondays through Fridays 9am to 2pm Work well with staff, volunteers, and clients Ability to communicate effectively Sensitive to diverse cultures Food handler OR OSHA certified preferred but not mandatory
11104.title: Help Serve Lunch to Seniors at Sunnyside!

10543.description: Open Door Family Medical Centers, in partnership with Feeding Westchester (formerly the Food Bank of Westchester) and the Larchmont Mamaroneck Hunger Task Force, hosts a massive giveaway of over 10,000 pounds fresh produce donated by Hunts on the last Saturday of each month! Volunteers set up tables, unload the produce from large pallets, pre-bag smaller items, clean-up the parking area and stack the sorted piles of empty cartons, crates, and pallets for the recycling. Times: Volunteer for one or more shift! 9:30 AM - 12:30 PM Noon- 2:30 PM 9:30 AM - 2:30 PM Last Saturday of Each Month Location: Open Door Family Medical Center 689 Mamaroneck Avenue, Mamaroneck Requirements: Able to lift 30 lbs. Spanish Language Skills beneficial High School Students Welcome! Children over 14 yrs with Adult! On-line Application Completed For additional information contact Jane Levy, Manager of Volunteer Programs jlevy@odfmc.org
10543.title: Spread the Wealth! Fresh Nutritious Produce Free Market
10543.org: Open Door Family Medical Centers Inc

11375.description: Join us as we make local visits to seniors for Chanukah. Volunteers will pack holiday bags and deliver them to local homes and visit with Seniors. YOU MUST REGISTER WITH THIS LINK: http://cerv.is/m?0295geJ6WgJ We have locations in Forest Hills and Little Neck QNS. There are two locations, please register at the location closest to you. Forest Hills Little Neck - Must have ability to drive or ride in automobile w/ GPS Forest Hills - In walking distance to most of the apartments. All ages welcome including children.
11375.title: Chanukah Home Visits w/ Seniors
