10031.description: City Tutors is looking for a professional(s) to serve as a mentor for a City College of New York (CUNY) course called Vocation, Career and Self-Development which runs from 5-7PM on Thursdays in the Fall semeter. The mentor would help students in the class with revising their resumes, and would conduct mock interviews. Ideally the mentor would be available to come in the class from 6-7pm at least during the first few sessions so that a relationship with the students can quickly be established. Most of the work can be done over virtual platform. The mentor would work closely in coordination with the instructor of the course. Here is a description of the course: This course aims to provide students with practical tools and applied knowledge on how best to find a fulfilling job in today’s, increasingly competitive, job market. It is divided in four parts, or modules. The first deals with vocation; that is, establishing what career path(s) best fit your talents, values and aspirations. The second aims at establishing what kind of experience you need to best achieve your career goals, both in terms of academic study and extra-curricular activities. The third concerns the networking and information-gathering skills you will need, both online and in person, to find the right job opportunities for you. Finally, the last and largest module deals with self-presentation and interviewing techniques, with specific training and evaluation sessions on résumé and cover-letter writing as well as job interview strategy and performance. As an applied and participatory course, classes will involve a variety of pedagogical exercises in addition to lectures by the instructor and a number of invited guests from the business world. Students will be required to participate in mock interviews, acting both as 'interviewers’ and 'interviewees’, but also to comment on and evaluate on each other’s résumés and cover letters, and participate in a number of other in-class exercises aimed at fostering self-awareness, networking skills and team-building ability.
10031.title: Seeking Mentor(s) to support a CCNY course titled: Vocation, Career, and Self-Development

10030.description: Behind the Book (www.behindthebook.org) is a non-profit literacy organization that inspires New York City public school students to love reading. Through our rich, innovative programs, accomplished authors visit high-needs pre-K-12 classrooms, where they guide students in creating their own writing projects based on the theme of the author's book. BtB seeks volunteer photographers and videographers to document students, authors, and volunteer coaches during classroom workshops and field trips. It's ideal if you have experience working with pre-K to high school-age students. You may also cover fundraising and other events. Examples of photos can be found on our Instagram feed at www.instagram.com/behindthebook/. To apply, or for more information, contact volunteer@behindthebook.org. Please include a link to your website, portfolio or other samples of your work in either or both areas.
10030.title: Photographer/Videographer

11756.description: volunteer coaches needed for Girls on the Run to lead a team of 8-15 girls in 5th grade after school hours. Training, Easy-to-follow curriculum and materials provided.
11756.title: Assistant Coaches-Island Trees Middle School
11756.org: GIRLS ON THE RUN LONG ISLAND INC

10451.description: Join New York Common Pantry's Live Healthy! Team to help distribute fruits and vegetables to parents at John Peter Zenger PS 18X. Responsibilities include: Set up the Corbin Hill Fruit and Vegetable Stand. Itemize all Fruits and Vegetables before distribution. Distribute Fruits and Vegetable Shares to parents and staff. Signed up parents and staff for next distribution. Clean up the Corbin Hill Fruits and Vegetables Stand. Qualifications Must be able to lift up to 40 pound Spanish speaking volunteers are welcome, but NOT required High School Degree minimum CSA pickups take place at the school on Thursdays from 1-5 PM. You may sign up for individual 1-hour shifts!
10451.title: Volunteer with NY Common Pantry and Corbin Hill

10451.description: Overview: Special Events Interns work closely with South Bronx United’s Executive Director in planning and managing nonprofit fundraising events with a focus on SBU’s Annual Benefit. The Annual Benefit, which raised $111,000 last year, represents a significant and essential portion of SBU’s operating budget allowing SBU to keep pace with growing programming needs of Bronx youth. When: September - November. Exact hours are flexible and will fluctuate according to key periods with more hours likely needed immediately prior to the Benefit in early November, and the Benefit on November 8th. Where: SBU Office 594 Grand Concourse Bronx, NY 10451 *Work can often be done remotely if needed. Commitment: 10-15 hours a week, May-early November. The workload of the position is expected to fluctuate around key periods, but is often flexible for a candidate to choose their hours. Training: All interns will be trained and supervised by the Development Manager.. Benefits: While the position is unpaid, interns have the opportunity to see the inner workings of a small but growing non profit and the process of planning and managing a major fundraising event. Responsibilities in Detail: * Support a team, the SBU Benefit Committee, in planning and promoting the 5th Annual SBU Benefit * Solicit donations for the event (venue, food, drinks, auctions items, etc) * Organize event logistics (catering, registration, recruiting and training volunteers, music, awards program, etc.) * Manage guest list, ticket purchases, monetary donations, and mailing list * Support creation of event materials (save the date, evite, sponsor letters) * Create financial reports for event * Create run of show for event day and evening * Promote event on social media and with appropriate mainstream media * Support other fundraising events as planned by SBU’s Junior Board Qualifications: Along with possessing a passion for supporting non profit work and serving urban youth, an intern should have strong communication and writing skills and comfort using Microsoft Excel and Google Documents. Additionally, an ideal candidate would also have a BA in communications, non profit management, marketing or another related field, as well as experience in event planning and/or fundraising.
10451.title: Special Events Internship

10451.description: We need volunteers to attend our weekly POPS meetings. The meetings are approximately thirty minutes long and meet every week during the students' lunch. POPS is a nonprofit that creates a sacred space for students that have been impacted by incarceration. Our high school-based clubs meet weekly to nourish, empower, heal and inspire through creative expression and emotional support. We provide students with the tools and confidence to educate the broader community. Our core work takes place during weekly POPS the Club meetings where participants break bread and break their silence. Following their communal meals, students benefit from the wisdom of guest speakers, from opportunities for writing and making art, from conversation and from mindfulness exercises.
10451.title: Chance to help high school students who have been impacted by incarceration

10451.description: Overview: Rec League Coaches work with one team of girls and/or boys within the SBU Recreational Soccer League during Fall and/or Spring Seasons. Coaches run short practices and manage games for youth that compete against the other teams within the SBU league, which consists of 12 age groups and over 80 teams. Coaches not only share the joy of playing the sport, but also reinforce the values that sport helps develop (teamwork, discipline, respect, etc). When: * Saturday morning/afternoon in Fall and/or Spring. Coaches volunteer a set 1.5-2 hour slot between 9am-5pm. The time slot is dependent on the age group being coached. * Fall runs September 8th -November 17th * Spring runs mid-March - June Where: (Coaches are only required to be at one site) * Macomb's Dam Field: 161st St between River and Jerome Avenues. The field is on the South side of Yankee Stadium across from Gate 4. * Mullaly Park: Jerome Avenue at 165th Street. Park is on the north side of Yankee Stadium * Patterson Playground: 445 College Ave Bronx, NY 10451 Commitment: * Coaches must be able to commit to being present for at least a 1.5 hours every Saturday (excluding holiday weekends) during the season. * One season commitment minimum, but two seasons is preferred. * Coaches should understand they will be the point person for contact with families and players and willing to make phone calls home to ensure plays are aware of games/other important news. Qualifications: Previous coaching experience is not required, but enthusiasm for working with children is a necessity. Training: We will provide volunteers with orientation materials, coaching training, and a coaching manual. A formal orientation/ training will be held prior to each season. Coaches will be assigned to age groups (age 4-19) based on experience, availability, and preference. Benefits: In addition to helping provide the resources and support to allow under resourced youth the opportunity to participate in an organized sport, coaches will have opportunities for professional coaching trainings and will be connected to a network of caring volunteers for fun soccer related events throughout the year.
10451.title: Youth Recreational Soccer Coach

10451.description: Overview: Non profit development interns work closely with South Bronx United's Executive Director in building organizational capacity in support of SBU's youth development programs, which use soccer as a tool to help youth advance academically, graduate high school, and go on to college. Intern's work is focused in 3 key areas: 1) grant research & writing, 2) press relations and social media, and 3) fundraising through special events and sponsorships. Within these areas, the position can be molded to fit the individual's strengths and interests. When: Fall Internship: September - December Spring Internship: mid/late January - May Where: SBU Office, 594 Grand Concourse, Bronx, NY 10451. *There is flexibility to work remotely at times. Qualifications: Along with possessing a passion for supporting non profit work and serving urban youth, an intern should have a strong communication and writing skills and comfort using Microsoft Excel and Google Documents. Additionally, an ideal candidate should have a BA in communications, non profit management, marketing or another related field. Experience in event planning and/or fundraising is a plus but not essential. Commitment: 10-15 hours a week for at least one semester. Training: All interns will be trained and supervised by the Executive Director. Benefits: While the position is unpaid, inters have the opportunity to see the inner workings of a small but growing non profit and get experience in providing the resources and support needed for program sustainability.
10451.title: Non Profit Development Internship

10451.description: Overview: Tutors for the SBU Sophomore Skills program work with small groups of Sophomores and provide them with the academic support needed to graduate high school and go to college. Each tutoring session is split into two parts. Tutoring starts with half an hour of homework help and is followed by an hour-long lesson. During this time tutors follow a set curriculum, developed by SBU, for teaching weekly lessons in either math or English. Tutors work with the same group of students every week. This provides tutors the opportunity to build relationships and to serve as a positive role model in youth’s lives while also promoting the importance of education. When: Mondays 6:00 - 8:00pm (English) Wednesdays 6:00 - 8:00pm (Math) 1st Semester: mid September - mid January 2nd Semester: early February - early June Where: Urban Assembly School for Careers in Sports, Mott Haven HS Campus, 730 Concourse Village West, Bronx, NY 10451 Commitment: Tutors are asked to commit to teaching either English or Math for 2 hours, one evening a week for at least one semester (Sept-Jan or Feb-June). However, if a tutor would like to be more involved, he/she is always welcome. Qualifications: South Bronx United is looking for highly motivated, energetic volunteers who want to make a difference in the lives of South Bronx youth. Tutors should possess either strong math or English skills, and feel comfortable breaking down and explaining processes for problem solving. Tutors should also be willing to review the provided weekly math or English lessons beforehand so that they are prepared for working with the students. Training: An orientation and training at the beginning of service will be run for all tutors to give general guidelines, tutoring tips and to go over the specific needs of the students. Additional training and \"check ins\" will be conducted intermittently throughout the course of the year. Benefits: In addition to helping provide the resources and support to allow under-served students to thrive in school, SBU is happy to connect with your school to see if your volunteer hours can work towards school service or academic requirements. Beyond Tutoring: The boys and girls participating in the program are also members of the South Bronx United Travel Soccer Teams. Tutors are welcome and encouraged to come out and see a game or get involved in a practice as SBU youth are extremely passionate about the sport and it’s a great way to connect with the kids.
10451.title: College Prep Tutor - Sophomores

10451.description: Overview: South Bronx United Education Interns work closely with SBU educational staff in coordinating and supervising the SBU After School Tutoring Program. The program provides homework help and academic enrichment activities for approximately 80 youth ages 10-15. Interns work 3-5 days a week from 3:30-6:30 pm and get hands on experience administering an educational program, counseling and tutoring youth, and developing educational resources. The internship is perfect for those looking to gain experience in the fields of education, school counseling, and social work. When: Fall Internship: September - mid/late January Spring Internship: mid/late January - May Where: The Urban Assembly School for Careers in Sports, 2nd Floor, Mott Haven Campus 730 Concourse Village West, Bronx, NY 10451 Commitment: A minimum of 3 days a week from 3:30-6:30, Monday-Friday for at least one semester. Training: All interns will receive training from our Director of Education and Social Worker prior to working in the classroom. Benefits: While the position is unpaid, interns have the opportunity to work directly with veteran educators and a licensed master of social work in an educational setting. Interns will get hands on experience in developing learning resources, managing a classroom, and working with students who have the greatest educational and/or emotional needs. Interns will have the opportunity to learn how to read and understand students Individualized Education Plans (IEPs) Responsibilities in Detail: Interns assist in three major program areas. Depending on the specific interests and skill set of the intern the job can be focused on one or more of these areas: Education * Provide tutoring to youth within the program with a focus on Special Education students * Support staff with classroom management * Help build the database of educational resources and develop lesson plans * Support the Education Director in building a middle school curriculum Programmatic * Track student behavioral incidents and progress * Organize and maintain classroom space, program records and academic resources * Support staff in tracking academic progress at tutoring and school * Assist with volunteer recruitment and management Counseling * Help resolve conflicts between youth and manage behavior * Work with you in setting behavioral goals Qualifications: Enthusiastic and caring with a specific interest in social work, counseling, and youth empowerment. Should have a background in working with youth. Education, social work, psychology, sociology, or related majors are preferred. No soccer background necessary.
10451.title: Education Internship

10451.description: Overview: SBU College Prep Mentors provide program youth with the tools necessary to graduate high school and attend college. College Prep Mentors are matched with 2-3 SBU high school seniors as they prepare for senior year exams and navigate the college application process. Mentors focus primarily on assisting with applications, but may be called on to provide support with SAT/ACT and Regents exam preparation. Mentors promote the importance of education and serve as positive role models in youths' lives. When: Wednesdays, 6:00-8:00pm, September - June Where: Urban Assembly School for Careers in Sports, Mott Haven HS Campus, 730 Concourse Village West, Bronx, NY 10451 Commitment: Tutors are asked to commit to one evening a week for 2 hours for the entirety of the school year (Sept-June). However, if a tutor would like to be more involved, he/she is always welcome. Qualifications: South Bronx United is looking for highly motivated, energetic volunteers who want to make a difference in the lives of South Bronx youth. Volunteers should have gone through the college application process themselves, with a preference for those who have already obtained a bachelor's degree. It's not expected that tutors will be experts on the process, but they should be willing to work hard to help students with finding answers and staying on track throughout the process. Training: A orientation and training will be held before the start of the program to provide an overview of the program and start to cover some of the ins and outs of the application process. Further training will be held throughout the year to cover specific topic areas of the application process in more depth. Benefits: In addition to helping provide the resources and support to allow underserved students to thrive in school, SBU is happy to connect with your school to see if your volunteer hours can work towards school service or academic requirements. Beyond Tutoring: The boys and girls participating in the program are also members of the South Bronx United Travel Soccer Teams. Tutors are welcome and encouraged to come out and see a game or get involved in a practice as youth are extremely passionate about the sport and its a great way to connect with the kids.
10451.title: College Prep Mentor

10451.description: Live Healthy! is looking for a few volunteers to be a part of their Greenmarket Nutrition Workshop and Culinary Demos team. Three times a week with 2 shift options including morning shift (9 am-12 pm) or afternoon shift (12 pm-3 pm). Live Healthy! provides nutrition workshops on how to increase fruits and vegetable intake while providing a delicious and nutritious recipe demo that includes ingredients found right at the farmers' market. Volunteers are needed to help with set-up, break-down, and overall management of the workshops. Someone with a can do attitude, who's ready to take the initiative, and who thoroughly enjoys interacting with people as a representative of NYCP in the community would be an ideal candidate. It's a team effort out at the Greenmarket, and each person plays a vital role! Volunteers must be at least 16 years or older, be able to lift at least 30 lbs, and be comfortable in a variety of outdoor environments.
10451.title: Join NYCP's Nutrition Education Team at the Farmers' Market!

11753.description: Girls on the Run is looking for some energetic people to help lead this curriculum based program. Starts in mid September and ends with a 5K on December 2nd. You do not need to run to coach with this program! Please see our website for more info www.gotrlongisland.org
11753.title: Assistant Coaches -Jericho Middle School
11753.org: GIRLS ON THE RUN LONG ISLAND INC

07430.description: Pony Power Therapies is looking for volunteers to assist in therapeutic horse-back riding lessons as lead walkers for our Fall Semester! Must be 14 years or older! Must have previous horse experience! Orientation and training are required! Please visit www.ponypowernj.org for more information on Pony Power Therapies. Interested individuals can email volunteers@ponypowernj.org or call our office at 201-934-1001.
07430.title: Love Horses - Volunteers Needed

07430.description: ENROLLMENT FOR VOLUNTEERS FOR PONY POWER THERAPIES FALL SEMESTER IS NOW OPEN! Pony Power Therapies is looking for volunteers to assist in therapeutic horse-back riding lessons as lead walkers for our Fall Semester! Lead walkers are responsible for handling the horse during lessons and only those with previous horse experience will be assigned as Lead Walkers. Lessons run Sunday through Thursday. Our Fall Semester begins on Tuesday, September 11th and runs through to Thursday, December 20th. Volunteer Handbook, application and schedule will be emailed to you and application needs to be returned to our office prior to registering for a volunteer training class. Pony Power Therapies gives special needs and at-risk children and adults a unique opportunity to ride, care for and interact with horses. Our riding and non-riding activities enhance individuals' physical, social and emotional well-being in a safe, nurturing farm environment. Please visit www.ponypowernj.org for more information on Pony Power Therapies. Interested individuals can email volunteers@ponypowernj.org or call our office at 201-934-1001.
07430.title: Fall Semester Horse Handler Volunteers for Pony Power Therapies Needed!

07430.description: ENROLLMENT FOR VOLUNTEERS NOW OPEN FOR PONY POWER THERAPIES' FALL SEMESTER! Pony Power Therapies is looking for volunteers to assist in therapeutic horse-back riding lessons as side walkers for our Fall Semester! Under the supervision of a certified riding instructor, the side walker walks next to the horse to provide support to the rider as needed. Lessons run Sunday through Thursday. Our Fall Semester begins on Tuesday, September 11th and runs through to Thursday, December 20th. Volunteer Handbook, application and schedule will be emailed to you and application needs to be returned to our office prior to registering for a volunteer training class. Pony Power Therapies gives special needs and at-risk children and adults a unique opportunity to ride, care for and interact with horses. Our riding and non-riding activities enhance individuals' physical, social and emotional well-being in a safe, nurturing farm environment. Please visit www.ponypowernj.org for more information on Pony Power Therapies. Interested individuals can email volunteers@ponypowernj.org or call our office at 201-934-1001.
07430.title: Fall Semester Side Walker Volunteers for Pony Power Therapies Needed!

11004.description: About Are you excited for the Fall events throughout New York? Along with three local organizations supporting the lives of individuals with intellectual and developmental disabilities, The PAL Program is taking a field trip to Queens County Farm and we are looking for additional people to be PAL's (volunteers) within the program. The PAL Program discovers a member’s passion, interests, and matches up the individual with a person or place in the community sharing a similar passion or interest. We discover what you enjoy and how it could potentially match with a member of PHP. Activities Hay rides, corn maze, pumpkin picking, and more! Will be a part of the video clip to be posted on 3 accounts. Bring a small amount of money for yourself to be discussed for activities! Benefits Receive an optional professional reference upon completion of program Join an incredible community of passionate staff and volunteers Hours: For this particular event, it is only 3 hours, but if matched with a member in the program, hours will vary! Suggested Commitment: 6 months - 1 year PHP provides equal opportunity for all volunteers.
11004.title: Fall Field Trip!

11694.description: Help GrowNYC create an event where people find things they need and reduce waste! At Stop 'N’ Swaps New Yorkers bring items they no longer need and find things that are new to them. The public is invited to bring and take gently-used items, like books, clothes, household goods, and toys. You don't need to bring something to take something. The only things we don’t take are large items/furniture. As a volunteer you will help receive, sort, and display the gently used items that people bring. You might also help keep areas neat, take pictures, or help promote some of the other great work GrowNYC's Zero Waste Program does! Stop 'N' Swaps encourage reuse, build community, and reduce the waste NYC sends to landfills. By volunteering you will create an opportunity for people to bring things they no longer need instead of throwing them away, and find things they do want without manufacturing, packaging, or transportation.
11694.title: Rockaway Park Stop 'N' Swap

11356.description: This is our annual Fall Festival - we will be raking leaves in this 27-acre park and depositing them into our new leaf compost bin. That compost will be given to the community in the spring! We will also plant 550 daffodil bulbs to beautify the park.
11356.title: Fall Fest: Raking and daffodil planting at MacNeil Park

11590.description: At the AHRC Walk, a community of people with intellectual and developmental disabilities and the passionate people who care about them, walk together to show the world the importance of raising awareness and funds to support inclusion and life-changing opportunities for people with developmental disabilities. Volunteering at the AHRC Walk is a fun and rewarding experience... we couldn't do what we do without YOU! Our amazing volunteers form the backbone of the Walk team and we would love you to join our incredible family! There's no registration fee for volunteers, and although volunteers are not required to fundraise, you're certainly welcome to do so. There are many different roles and tasks, depending on when and where we need you. You will be contacted about your walk day assignments as we get closer to the event. For more information about how you can help with this event contact the volunteer coordinator at 516-626-1000 ext. 1303 or jmcdannell@ahrc.org To sign up go to ahrcwalk.com
11590.title: AHRC Walk

11590.description: We Connect The Dots started over five years committed to transform education and empower students with the tools they need to succeed in today's workforce. We could NEVER have come this far without all the volunteers along the way these past five years. Our organization is made up 100% of volunteers. We are planning our first annual Volunteer Recognition event and need a coordinator to spearhead the planning. If you are organized and enjoy event planning please consider joining our team. This is just one of several events we have planned throughout the year.
11590.title: Event Planner Needed for Volunteer Recognition Event

11590.description: Community Connections of Long Island, Inc. is a community-based non-profit organization operating a youth-staffed market that provides fresh, affordable Long Island produce to residents of New Cassel, Westbury and surrounding areas. The project replicates a popular model developed by Sustainable Long Island and now facilitated by Northwell/Long Island Green Markets which also provides technical assistance to the market. This model allows local teens to earn important business and customer service skills through job training and employment while providing the community at large with fruits and vegetables from local Long Island farms. New Cassel Farmers' Market is seeking ten high school aged students from Westbury/New Cassel to work with the community youth farmers markets throughout the 2018 summer and fall seasons. Selected students will be expected to participate in weekly markets, promote and publicize market activities, and work under the direct supervision of a market manager; who will run the farm stands on behalf of local farmers.
11590.title: Farmers' Market Volunteer
11590.org: Community Connections of Long Island, Inc./New Cassel Farmers' Market

07631.description: The National MS Society is looking for volunteers to help with Bike MS: New York City’s Rest Stop location in Englewood! Bike MS New York City will be held on Sunday, October 21 - Rest Stop volunteers are needed from 8:00am-4:30pm in Englewood, NJ. We welcome groups and individuals of all ages and abilities to join us as volunteers! Bike MS: New York City is a unique experience - the 30 mile route around Manhattan is completely traffic free. The 50 and 100 mile rides allow cyclists to ride through the Holland Tunnel traffic free. More than 300 volunteers are needed to make this event a success! If you are interested in volunteering, please review the position below and register online here: https://www.signupgenius.com/go/20f0944acab22abfd0-201813 Rest Stop Support Team: Date: Sunday, October 21, 2018 Time: 8:00am-1:00pm (Shift 1) / 12:30pm-5:00pm (Shift 2) Location: Englewood, NJ Description: Volunteers will be assigned to the Englewood rest stop which is along the Bike MS: New York City route. Volunteers will distribute water, snacks and cheer on walkers! If you have any questions, please contact: NYC Volunteer Engagement Team at NYCSNY.Volunteers@nmss.org or 212-453-3258
07631.title: Rest Stop Volunteers Needed in Englewood for Bike MS: NYC!
07631.org: National MS Society - New York City

10462.description: Hello! We are a family-run charity English school based in China's Dragon City. If you're aiming to make a difference, travel or are taking a gap year then we might just be what you're looking for. We are searching for enthusiastic people to come and join us immediately as teachers. No experience as a teacher is required, just a positive attitude, a love for working with children and a desire to see more of the world! Through local funding we are excited to be able to provide 4 people from the US or UK paid volunteer positions and the chance to come and work with us for 6-12 months and really make a difference, not just in our local community, but all over the world through the work we do. We Provide: - 4 day working week, with 3 days off each week to travel China (we offer a weekly itinerary of different places to visit) - 4000rmb monthly allowance for travel and food - Free return flight home (or to your next adventure) for those who are able to stay for 12 months - Free Chinese lessons 4 times a week - Free use of school bikes and scooters - Accommodation with kitchen, bathroom, bedroom, wifi, electricity and gas bills all included - Provided meals on weekend days - Full teacher training - Invitations to random fun activities (BBQ's, Kayaking etc...) and visits to local towns and places of interest In return you'll be helping both the local and international English teaching community through a variety of jobs, including (but not limited to) teaching English classes, the creation of fun English speaking games, field trips, cooking classes, elderly home visits, community inclusion activities (free pancake offering on the street, line dancing with local \"aunties\", movie nights, story telling and much more!) and a whole host of other things! If you are interested please see our website www.dandaschool.com for more information or apply here with a copy of you CV, accompanied by a paragraph introducing yourself and explaining why you would like to come. Please add any questions you may have for us the application and we'll be happy to answer. We are looking for people to start before the school year begins (September 1st), as such, the interview process is quick with all initial successful applications given a Skype interview, with decisions made within a few days. Thank you so much for your time, please share on your Facebook or other social media if you think you have a friend who might be interested! Kind Regards, Dec & Any The D and A in D&A
10462.title: Want a Genuinely Wonderful China Experience? Join D&A Charity School and Become an English Teacher

11554.description: The Leukemia & Lymphoma Society is looking for volunteers to help Set-Up for our 2018 Light the Night Walk About the Walk: The Leukemia & Lymphoma Society’s (LLS) Light The Night Walk is an inspirational community event that raises awareness and funding for groundbreaking research and treatment options to eliminate cancer. This special evening brings light to the darkness of cancer through hope, research and support. Friends, families and co-workers form fundraising teams and millions of consumers help by donating at retail outlets. In 2017, LLS’s Light The Night took place in more than 150 communities and raised more than $68.5 million. The Walk will have special opportunities to recognize Patients & Survivors and to reflect on loved ones lost. Volunteer Opportunities Include: Event Setup
11554.title: Calling all Volunteers!
11554.org: Leukemia & Lymphoma Society -  Long Island Chapter

11554.description: T he Long Island Friends of People With AIDS in conjunction with Nassau University Medical Center joyously announce our Thirty-First Annual Thanksgiving Dinner Celebration Visit. We will be visiting people with HIV/AIDS and other patients on Sunday the 18th of November from 3:00 pm to 5:30 pm. The purpose of this event is to be with and bring cheer to patients, and to raise the awareness of the AIDS crisis. Complimentary Thanksgiving Dinner for All If you need more information, please feel free to call me at 516-445-2093. Thanks........Allan
11554.title: LONG ISLAND FRIENDS OF PEOPLE WITH AIDS THANKSGIVING VISIT

If you are interested in volunteering, please review the position below and register online here: https://www.signupgenius.com/go/20f0944acab22abfd0-201813 Rest Stop Support Team: Date: Sunday, October 21, 2018 Time: 7:30am-12:30pm (Shift 1) / 12:00pm-4:45pm (Shift 2) Location: Closter, NJ Description: Volunteers will be assigned to the Closter rest stop which is along the Bike MS: New York City route. 07960.description: This outdoor hands-on class teaches the safe, easy and effective way to learn to ride on two wheels. Using this \"balance first\" method, parents help get their children rolling while the child does most of the work. Participants learn the basics of balancing, starting, stopping and steering a bike as well as proper helmet fit and adjustment. Volunteers will be given training on how to fit a helmet and how to make minor bike adjustments. As a volunteer at this event, we need your help with the following: o Assist instructors with bicycle preparation o Removing bike pedals o Lowering seats o Bike sizing o Tire inflation o Brake check o Provide assistance guiding children through the course o Ability to work and stand in the sun for 3-4 hours o Ability to bend o Ability to jog behind the children’s bikes if necessary
07960.title: Help Kids Learn to Ride a Bike! 10/14/18

07960.description: We are beginning to recruit interested volunteers for our upcoming New Jersey Confidential Sexual Violence Victim Advocate (CSVA) training, which is slated to begin in October 2018 one day a week from 5:30 PM-9:30PM for 10 weeks. During the 40 hour training volunteers are educated about topics regarding sexual assault statistics, prevention, and response. Crisis intervention and advocacy support skills are taught and guest speakers, including law enforcement, military experts, and mental health professionals present information. When the volunteer completes the training and receives the CSVA status, they are required to manage the crisis hotline for three 12 hour shifts per month. (The hotline is forwarded to the volunteer's telephone for their shifts.) In addition to hotline, the advocate's second responsibility per shift is to accompany survivors of sexual assault to the hospital as needed. Although this is a challenging volunteer position, the experience is very rewarding (and looks great on a resume too)! Join our team and support survivors!
07960.title: Sexual Assault Response Team Advocate Training

07620.description: The National MS Society is looking for volunteers to help with Bike MS: New York City’s Rest Stop location in Alpine! Bike MS New York City will be held on Sunday, October 21 - Rest Stop volunteers are needed from 7:30am-10:30am in Alpine, NJ. We welcome groups and individuals of all ages and abilities to join us as volunteers! Bike MS: New York City is a unique experience - the 30 mile route around Manhattan is completely traffic free. The 50 and 100 mile rides allow cyclists to ride through the Holland Tunnel traffic free. More than 300 volunteers are needed to make this event a success! Volunteers will distribute water, snacks and cheer on walkers! If you have any questions, please contact: NYC Volunteer Engagement Team at NYCSNY.Volunteers@nmss.org or 212-453-3258
07620.title: Rest Stop Volunteers Needed in Alpine for Bike MS: NYC!
07620.org: National MS Society - New York City

11214.description: Looking for a group facilitator for a youth group to run various activities to promote mental health awareness, improve social skills and team building.
11214.title: Youth group facilitator

07643.description: Tutor and coach K-12 students withe academic support at the Meadowlands Success Center.
07643.title: Homework Helpers in Little Ferry

10305.description: Sunday, October 14th | Staten Island | 12:00pm-3:00pm Have fun and make an impact during The Jewish Board's 2018 Month of Hope! Throughout the month of October, some of The Jewish Board's programs will host a wide variety of exciting volunteer projects. Join the young adolescents in designing and painting a mural to beautify the walls of their residence.
10305.title: Month of Hope: Mural Making in Staten Island
10305.org: Jewish Board of Family and Children's Services

10303.description: We are seeking three volunteer to help with answering the phone, filing documents, and processing and scheduling appointments for new intakes. A volunteer would be assigned to work any of the three shifts or may choose to work longer hours based on his/her availability. The shifts are 9:30 - 1:00, 12:30- 4:30 and 4:00 to 9:00 PM. We could also schedule your shift according to your availability. Students and retirees are encouraged to apply. Please email your resume and cover letter to wewal75@yahoo.com .
10303.title: OFFICE ASSISTANT/OFFICE MANAGER
10303.org: World Association for Community Empowerment, Inc.

10303.description: We are currently looking for volunteers with teaching experience or college students/graduates to help disadvantage children in the Parkhill/Stapleton and Arlington Terrace community on Staten Island with home work help and after school tutorial. The afterschool program opportunity is available from 3:00 PM to 6:00 PM Mondays to Fridays. Volunteers may choose to work one day a week or up to five days a week based on availability. All selected volunteers will undergo background check to ensure the safety of the children participating in the program. Interested parties please email resume to wewal75@yahoo.com.
10303.title: Help Disadvantage Children with Homework!
10303.org: World Association for Community Empowerment, Inc.

10301.description: We are an agency that serves homebound older adults. Our mission is to keep them in their homes for as long as possible. Many of them are socially isolated and the only person they see each day is the driver who comes to drop off their meals on wheels. This does not provide the socialization they so desperately need. This is why we need you to be a friend to an older adult. To have a cup of coffee, tea, play cards, take a walk and/or just chat. We only ask for an hour per week. Volunteers can be from 18 to 80. To find out more about this opportunity please contact Rosanne McAllister 718-981-6226 ext. 141.
10301.title: Staten Island Volunteers needed to Brighten the Lives of Seniors.
10301.org: COMMUNITY AGENCY FOR SENIOR CITIZENS INC

10301.description: We have a lovely wheelchair bound senior who spends most of her days alone. This Client does not have much of a family. She loves old movies, and also loves to knit and crochet (she can even teach you!). She has 2 very friendly dogs but would love someone to come and chat with her and even sharpen her computer skills. If you can get to Travis and can spare one hour per week, please contact Rosanne McAllister at 718 981-6226, ext 141 for further information. Thanks in advance for your kindness. Your kindness will benefit someone who is alone and isolated.
10301.title: STATEN ISLANDERS!  Can you travel to Travis?
10301.org: COMMUNITY AGENCY FOR SENIOR CITIZENS INC

10301.description: We are Community Agency for Senior Citizens, Inc. We have been in Staten Island for over 40 years. We only serve Older Adults. The program is called the Friendly Visiting Program. The program began in January/2017. We look to \"Match\" you with an Older Adult. The program asks that you spend one hour in the Client's home. While visiting the Client, you can have a cup of coffee/tea, play a table top game, cards, read a book together, watch a movie. The visit is what you both decide upon. This is a building block relationship. So far, many of our \"Match's\" have become good friends and look forward to these weekly visits. Your volunteering brings much happiness to someone who is alone and isolated.
10301.title: Do You Want to Brighten Someone's Day? Volunteer's Are the Sunshine that Homebound Adult's Need
10301.org: COMMUNITY AGENCY FOR SENIOR CITIZENS INC

10028.description: Help roll out pumpkins, help kids with crafts, give kids hand stamps, help keep the park clean, help people move around to all the activities.
10028.title: Help with Carl Schurz Park Children's Harvest Festival 2018

10028.description: Enthusiastic volunteers are needed to introduce school children to art and museums. We will train you to give guided tours at the Brooklyn Museum of Art and Metropolitan Museum of Art, and to go into the classroom to prepare the students for their visit. Tours take place Monday through Friday, during the school year, between the hours of 10am and 1pm. ArtWorks volunteers are in 20 schools throughout the five boroughs and our classroom teachers love us!
10028.title: "Introduce Children to Art and Museums"

10028.description: We are in need of a CPR Instructor to teach some of the mothers of Nurse-Family Partnership. NFP sends specially trained nurses to do home visits with low-income first time mothers from the time they are pregnant until their babies are 2 years of age. We at Friends of NYC Nurse-Family Partnershipi arrange various learning opportunities for the mothers at sites in the 5 boroughs. As funds are extremely limited, we need a volunteer to do a one-hour class in CPR. The moms do not need to be certified. They want to learn CPR for babies and toddlers as well as the fundamentals for preventing choking. If you have some time to spare for a very worthy cause, please contact us and let us know your credentials.
10028.title: CPR INSTRUCTOR
10028.org: FRIENDS OF NEW YORK CITY NURSE FAMILY PARTNERSHIP INC

10028.description: Do you have a few hours to spend helping us devlop programs for young mothers and their babies? The mission of Friends of NYC Nurse-Family Partnereship is to improve the lives of babies and their mothers by providing enhanced benefits for the nationally renowned Nurse-Family Partnership. NFP sends registered nurses to make regular visits to first-time, low-income mothers, from the time the mothers are pregnant until their babies are 2. Friends of NYC NFP is developing and leading LEAP (Learn, Eat, and Play) programs which help the mothers meet and socialize with other young moms while learning about nutrition, finance, making toys out of household objects and much more. We need VOLUNTEERS who can help us create interesting play times for the babies. We'd like to: Showing mothers the importance of interactions with their baby Teach about a rich learning environment Show exercises which will allow babies to explore and learn Programs are held around midday during the week at locations in the boroughs of NYC. If interested, please send resume and phone number.
10028.title: Pre-School Teacher
10028.org: FRIENDS OF NEW YORK CITY NURSE FAMILY PARTNERSHIP INC

10028.description: Are you a singer, guitar player, or have other musical talents appropriate for young mothers and their babies? The babies are all under 2 years of age. If you have appropriate musical experience and talent and would like to entertain in such a situation and you are available week days, we would like to hear from you. Events typically last 2-3 hours; frequency would be once a quarter or more. Please send a note describing your musical background;experience with very young children a big plus. SEND YOUR RESUME AND PHONE NUMBER.
10028.title: Guitarist or Keyboard Player for Mother/Baby Events
10028.org: FRIENDS OF NEW YORK CITY NURSE FAMILY PARTNERSHIP INC

10029.description: Job Description: As a Cooking Class Assistant for after-school classes, you will be a key player in creating the culinary experiences that shape the future generation of creative cooks and thoughtful eaters. Along the way, you’ll have the opportunity to engage with the local community of families, chefs, and restaurants that have partnered with usto give kids from all backgrounds the opportunity to cook and eat healthy meals. Your Role: We need enthusiastic, food-savvy volunteers who are ready and eager to jump into the kitchen and lead cooking classes with middle school aged girls from East Harlem. A love for working with kids and experimenting with new recipes is a must. You will be responsible for leading students through a culinary lesson plan, ensuring kids stay safe in the kitchen, and maintaining a fun, friendly, and educational cooking environment. Professional Growth: This is your chance to get hands-on in a school classroom as you take your passions for food, cooking, education to the next level. In addition to engaging with local communities of families and students, you will also be working with a top chef from the Harlem community. Sample Tasks: Assist After-School Cooking Classes for middle school girls, teaching basic knife skills, chopping techniques, and kitchen safety Supervise groups of up to twenty students during cooking classes Set up and clean up spaces in schools as part of prep for cooking events Skills and Requirements: Cooking experience and comfortability in the kitchen (formal culinary experience is not required) Past experience working with kids Organized, creative, and able to adapt to situations on the fly Passion for education, cooking, nutrition, and teaching kids
10029.title: Cooking Class Assistant

10029.description: Dear Manhattan and Queens folks, On behalf of the Mount Sinai Sexual Assault and Violence Intervention (SAVI) Program, I wanted to invite you to join us in eradicating sexual and intimate partner violence from our communities. New York City needs you! By joining our roster of volunteer Emergency Department (ED) Advocates it is possible to have an impact. An ED Advocate is trained to provide support and advocacy for survivors in emergency departments, so they don’t have to face the difficult decisions, emotions and follow-up procedures alone. SAVI ED Advocates helped more than 500 survivors in New York City Emergency Departments last year- that’s almost 2 survivors a day! We hope you or someone you know may be interested in becoming a Volunteer Emergency Department Advocate. Those interested should visit https://tinyurl.com/savirecruit for information and the application. If you have any questions please call (212) 423-2140 or email savi@mssm.edu for the next steps. In your email please include your telephone number and the general best day(s) and time(s) to reach you at that number. Interviews will be held from July - October and those accepted into the program will begin training in October. More information is also available at our website: please visit www.mssm.edu/savi . Thank you so much for your help and we hope to hear from you! Your friends at The Mount Sinai SAVI Team
10029.title: Help Survivors of Sexual and Intimate Partner Violence - Manhattan and Queens Residents Needed!

10029.description: DREAM, an award winning youth development program, is seeking volunteer tutors to provide academic support to our middle school after-school students in East Harlem and the South Bronx. Tutors work with youth individually and in small groups to help improve student success in class, increase subject-specific retention, and contribute to overall academic enrichment and development. What You’ll Do Support academic enrichment activities, including homework help and tutoring; Provide individualized and team-wide support all after-school program activities and initiatives; Serve as a role model and build positive relationships with youth; What We’re Looking For Strong command of one or more of the following academic subjects: English, Math, Science, and/or Social Studies Previous experience working with youth; Possess creativity, enthusiasm, initative, flexibility, and patience; Solid oral communication skills; Ability to make a consistent, weekly commitment; Bachelor’s Degree (a plus); 1-2 years previous tutoring experience (a major plus). Benefits Gain invaluable experience and opportunities for professional development at an award-winning youth development program; Receive an optional professional reference upon completion of your service term; Join an incredible community of passionate staff and volunteers. Minimum Commitment: 1-2 hours per week for a full cycle. Cycle 1: October - December/ Cycle 2: February - May. When: ******Monday - Thursday******* 4pm-5pm (time depends on tutor availability and program site assignment) DREAM provides equal opportunity for all volunteers.
10029.title: Volunteer as a Middle School Tutor

10029.description: We're looking for several people to volunteer with our Meals on Wheels program on Saturday, October 27th! We welcome both individual volunteers and small groups. For over 40 years, Union Settlement has provided Meals on Wheels to East Harlem's older residents that are often economically struggling and living alone. Our Meals on Wheels program currently serves approximately 450 homebound seniors each day. Prior to the volunteer date, volunteers will be sent a short training video and brief quiz to help prepare them for participation with Meals on Wheels. Volunteers will help pack hot and cold meals and then join staff on deliveries where they will get to hand out meals to our clients and interact with the East Harlem community. Volunteers are not required to have a driver's license or own a car. When: Saturday, October 27th from 8:30am to 12:30pm Where: Jefferson Senior Center in East Harlem Interested individuals or groups should email Jeanette Iturbides -Volunteer Coordinator at jiturbides@unionsettlement.org with the subject line \"Saturday, October 13th Meals on Wheels Volunteer\".
10029.title: Volunteer with Meals on Wheels on Saturday, October 27th!

10029.description: We're looking for several people to volunteer with our Meals on Wheels program on Saturday, November 3rd! We welcome both individual volunteers and small groups. For over 40 years, Union Settlement has provided Meals on Wheels to East Harlem's older residents that are often economically struggling and living alone. Our Meals on Wheels program currently serves approximately 450 homebound seniors each day. Prior to the volunteer date, volunteers will be sent a short training video and brief quiz to help prepare them for participation with Meals on Wheels. Volunteers will help pack hot and cold meals and then join staff on deliveries where they will get to hand out meals to our clients and interact with the East Harlem community. Volunteers are not required to have a driver's license or own a car. When: Saturday, November 3rd from 8:30am to 12:30pm Where: Jefferson Senior Center in East Harlem Interested individuals or groups should email Jeanette Iturbides -Volunteer Coordinator at jiturbides@unionsettlement.org with the subject line \"Saturday, October 13th Meals on Wheels Volunteer\".
10029.title: Volunteer with Meals on Wheels on Saturday, November 3rd!

10029.description: Opus 118 Harlem School of Music ( www.Opus118.org) provides high-quality music instruction in an environment that nurtures excellence and creativity. Students in the East Harlem community are served with tuition-free twice-weekly group violin instruction during regular school hours and subsidized private instruction for violin, viola, cello, guitar, and piano after school hours. Opus 118 Harlem School of Music was founded by the now-legendary Roberta Guaspari, whose fight for in-school music programs in East Harlem became the subject of a documentary ( Small Wonders) and a feature film (Music from the Heart). Roberta continues to work in East Harlem Schools while actively training the next generation of teachers for Opus 118. Opus 118’s partnership with Kaufman Music Center ( www.kaufmanmusiccenter.org) has led to an exciting growth period, and we are currently interviewing qualified individuals to intern with us for the 2018-2019 school year, helping with administrative duties and assisting both teachers and students. This is an opportunity for those interested in arts administration to get hands-on experience in multiple facets of a non-profit organization. Department: Arts Administration Reports to: Director of Programs and Development Schedule: 12 hours per week, 3-6pm M-Th. Preference given to candidates who can commit to full 30 week calendar. Duties Required: serve as contact for parents of enrolled students at one After-School Program site receive and process student registrations enroll students in classes/lessons observe lesson schedule and notify parents/faculty of confirmed times and cancellations maintain accurate records of student attendance process tuition payments manage classroom scheduling and set-up assist with program-related publications, web-content, and social media prepare program enrollment and activity reports as needed additional responsibilities to be determined as needed, including performance management and organizational projects Requirements for the Position A passion for music education and working with young people Self-starting, organized, methodical Ability to work under pressure, multi-task, have outstanding interpersonal and communication skills A desire to learn about arts administration and the different tasks found within a non-profit environment An enthusiasm for learning and a willingness to take on a variety of tasks
10029.title: Non-Profit Music Organization Volunteer

10029.description: This is a wonderful opportunity to support school staff and elementary school students during lunchtime and recess from 10:30-11:30 am. Students eat in cafeteria from 10:30-11:00 am then go out to the school yard to play from 11-11:30 am. We are looking persons who can supervise students at the lunch table then lead them to the yard and facilitate organized play. We think of organized play broadly so it can include any sports, team building games, dance, art or any other. We will supply any equipment needed. This opportunity is for the entire school year but we are looking to place a few volunteers so if you can not commit to the full school year please let us know how many months you can commit to.
10029.title: Facilitate Elementary School Organized Play (Lunchtime)
10029.org: Ps 108 Assemblyman Angelo Del Toro Educational Com

10029.description: We are currently seeking Friendly Visiting Volunteers to visit with homebound seniors in Manhattan's East Harlem and Upper East Side. Volunteers commit to visiting a senior once a week for six months to a year, or longer, to form a friendship and provide company to a senior who has expressed a desire to make a new friend. Thank you for your interest in this program!
10029.title: Visit with a senior in East Harlem

10026.description: Each Wednesday, we prep & serve a simple vegetarian meal offering in Central Harlem for anyone who needs a meal. One can help cook and/or serve and/or clean up. Time commitment is flexible: 2 & 1/2 hours to prep/cook, 1 hour to set up/serve, 1 hour clean up. One can help out with any part of the meal. Any level of skill is accepted.
10026.title: Volunteer To Cook & Serve Every Wednesday

11226.description: Work with Adult Literacy Students at one of the five Brooklyn Public Library Learning Centers. Help them reach their personal goals. Lead reading and writing activities for small groups of adult learners who read below the fifth grade level. Assist them in using technology. We provide a 20 hour Volunteer Tutor Training where you will learn the BPL’s Literacy Program’s philosophy, how to use the library’s resources for instruction, and how to create effective lesson plans. Professional staff will encourage your development in this richly rewarding field. Volunteers must have a high school diploma or equivalent and a love of reading and writing. Volunteers are asked for a one year commitment to tutoring either 2 - 2 hours sessions, or 1 - 3-hour session per week. To learn more about the Brooklyn Public Library Learning Centers, please visit the BPL website at http://www.bklynlibrary.org. To register to attend a Volunteer Tutor Information Session, please click here.
11226.title: Literacy Volunteer Information Session
11226.org: The Learning Centers @ Brooklyn Public Library

11226.description: Providing Legal Permanent Residents (LPRs) a transparent pathway to Naturalization. Who: Volunteer (you) What: Through this opportunity, you will lead/assist with the instruction of LPRs in preparation to apply and become a Naturalized U.S. Citizen. We will attain this goal by utilizing Civics materials provided by USCIS and through your engagement of creating weekly lesson plans directing the topics of the week. Duties: Creation and teaching of weekly lesson plans 4/5 Assessments of Clients knowledge through this class 1/2 Mock Interview with Clients Participation in our Naturalization Workshop - providing clients and the community with free legal support in creating their N400 Application Reliable and Responsible When: Duration: 12 Weeks (Aug 18 - Nov 3) Time: 9am - 1:30pm (Saturday Commitment) Size: ~15 clients Where: Holy Innocents R.C. Church (Brooklyn, NY 11226) Why: Many legal green card holders are taken advantage of by outside organizations, paying outlandish fees and receive no results. Through our class we are providing Application for Naturalization help through a BIA Accredited lawyer and through our class, you will aid clients in understanding U.S. History and Civics. **Through our prior classes we have aided over 15 clients to become a Naturalized citizen with the help of completing their Application for Naturalization (N400), Civics and Citizenship Class, and Case Management. DLM (501c3): https://www.dlm.ngo/citizenship USCIS Resource: https://www.uscis.gov/citizenship Interested in this opportunity? Send your resume to \" contact@dlm.ngo\" Subject \"Volunteer - Pathway to Naturalization\" A member of our team will follow up with you.
11226.title: DLM: Teach Civics and Citizenship (to LPRs in Brooklyn)

11225.description: Academic Tutors ensure that are students have the academic and study skills needed to succeed in middle school and high school. As a college bound program, HEAF’s goal is for 100% of our scholars to graduate from both high school and a four year college. To ensure all HEAF scholars realize this goal, HEAF mandates tutoring and Academic Success Programs for scholars who fall below HEAF’S minimum academic standards of 80% and above in all core class. Tutors provide assistance to students in the core subject areas and are matched with students based on the coach’s skills in specific subject areas and the student’s needs. Responsibilities: Middle School: Assess and assist students with homework and/or test preparation in at least one of the core subjects: Math, English Language Arts (ELA), Science, and Social Studies - see below for more details about concepts covered in each subject area 6 th Grade Math: ratios, percentages, decimals 7 th Grade Math: solving for X, single variable equations, perimeter, area, circumference 8 th Grade Math: plotting points on a graph, Algebra 1, multiple variable equations 6 th Grade ELA: figurative language, similes, metaphors 7 th Grade ELA: identifying themes in text , drawing inferences, understanding subtext 8 th Grade ELA: comparing and contrasting, analyzing and critically evaluating text, essay writing High School: Assess and assist students in at least one of the core subjects. High School Subject areas that our students have identified needing support in are: Math ( Algebra , Geometry , Trigonometry) Global History US History English Languages ( Spanish, French, Mandarin) Science ( Physics, Biology, Earth Science, Chemistry Evaluate and record student progress after each session Attend and participate in scheduled tutor orientation & training meetings Communicate academic and behavioral progress to program staff Outreach to parents and teachers a minimum of two times per term Create a rich learning environment that aids in instructing students with various learning styles Complete and submit required documentation, including timesheet and session logs Qualifications: Bachelor’s degree preferred - some college required. (Masters students in Education encouraged to apply) Advanced skills in Mathematics, English Language Arts, Science, and/or Social Studies Experience tutoring middle school students Strong work ethic and interpersonal skills Willingness to promote HEAF educational and youth development philosophy Ability to work collaboratively with others Bilingual (Spanish/English) candidates are highly encouraged to apply Prior knowledge of the NYC educational landscape/high school application process is a plus Time Commitment: Academic Tutors are asked to make a minimum of a 90 minutes/week commitment for a minimum of one semester. HEAF’s HEAF@Brooklyn tutoring program operates on Saturdays from 2:30-4:00pm . Support: Orientation will be provided for all tutors at the beginning of each term. Additionally, tutors are given access to a folder of resources that can be used during their sessions. Optional training sessions are offered by our program team. Benefits Build one-on-one relationships with students, while instilling confidence in themselves and their academic abilities Work as part of a collaborative and innovative team Ensure our students have the skills necessary to successfully accomplish their academic goals This position is an unpaid, volunteer position that reports to the HEAF@Brooklyn Site Coordinator and the Associate Director for High Expectations, and is also supported by the Volunteer Engagement Coordinator.
11225.title: HEAF@Brooklyn Academic Tutor

10025.description: Whether you're great, good or fair at Science, Technology, Engineering and Math (STEM), you can help make an impact on inner-city youth. Here's how: The Parris Foundation S.T.E.M.ulating Minds Weekend Enrichment Program has returned for the Fall 2017 session. The program began after a successful summer pilot in 2012, and our subsequent programs have grown to continue to serve middle school students and high school students . With the growing impact on the community, we need your support to continue to bring STEM to our middle school and high school youth throughout New York City. As we expand to more locations to serve more youth, there is a growing need for volunteers! How we do it: The Parris Foundation curriculum combines innovative and interactive software and teaching techniques with hand-ons interdisciplinary experiments and activities to keep our students engaged with their passion for science and math! About The Parris Foundation: The Parris Foundation is dedicated to promoting educational opportunities and fostering awareness in science, technology, engineering and math (STEM) through scholarships and community outreach programs. The Parris Foundation's S.T.E.M.ulating Minds: Weekend Enrichment Programs provide extended learning opportunities to supplement and enhance in-school learning.
10025.title: Fall 2017 - S.T.E.M.ulating Minds Weekend Enrichment Program

10025.description: Help GlamourGals supporters and alumna pamper nursing home residents with manicures and makeovers! GlamourGals uses makeup as a tool to create conversation and connection between generations. We will provide all the supplies necessary to give manicures, and makeovers (gentle facials, foundation, lipstick, and blush). For more information on our program, visit GlamourGals.org.
10025.title: Makeover with Upper West Side Seniors

10025.description: Top Honors is a non-profit educational organization that provides free math tutoring to NYC 5th, 6th, 7th, and 8th-graders. Tutoring takes place on Saturdays and Wednesday evenings at a school on the Upper West Side. New volunteer orientation and training sessions take place on a rolling basis. To receive an invitation, please submit an application here. Frequently asked questions about the TH volunteer experience can be found on our website. All tutoring sessions take place on the Upper West Side in Manhattan on the following days and times: Session 1: Saturdays from 10 a.m. to 12 p.m. Session 2: Saturdays from 1 p.m. to 3 p.m. Session 3: Wednesdays from 6:30 p.m. to 8 p.m. Volunteers may be professionals, advanced high school, college, or graduate students (community service credit is available). Applicants should be available on Saturdays for two hours starting at 10 a.m. or 1:00 p.m. or on Wednesdays from 6:30 - 8 pm, like math, and enjoy working with students in the middle school age group (10-14 years). No prior experience is necessary. A note on volunteer commitment: Tutors attend 2-3 Saturdays from October and May, which includes holidays and school breaks. To apply, submit an online application at www.tophonors.org/volunteer. Upon receipt, Top Honors will contact the candidate directly with an invitation to attend the next training.
10025.title: Do you love MATH? Volunteer MATH Tutors needed!

10025.description: Travelling to China to volunteer can sometimes be a daunting prospect, and devoting your time is one of the most generous things you can do. At D&A we want our volunteers to know we appreciate this and instead of charging you, as some volunteer companies do, we look to ensure that you aren’t just rewarded through the work you do, but for the amazing people you are! The following positions are available with us, we take each applicant on a case by case basis, experience in these areas isn’t always necessary so don’t hesitate in applying, for us passion beats experience: Education: - English Speaking Teachers - Dance Teachers - Art Teachers - Music Teachers, various instruments Farming: - Urban & Aquatic Farmers Recycling: - Up-cyclers - Jacks of all Trades *Please check our PROJECTS page at www.dandaschool.com/projects for more information about each role We provide all accommodation for free and provide a healthy living allowance for each volunteer who comes to work with us, as well as a long list of random goodies to make your life in China not just enjoyable, but something that will live with you for a lifetime. What is the accommodation like? - Kitchen, shared and fully kitted to enable you to eat how you like when you like - Bedrooms, with soft mattresses. We aim to provide everyone with private rooms, though in some cases shared accommodation - Living Room, comfortable sofa and projector for watching movies, but you’ll normally be out having fun! - Hot water and washing facilities, for those who worry China still hasn’t caught up with the rest of the world! - Electricity and gas provided free of charge, you won’t have to pay a thing Anything else provided? - 4000rmb a month volunteer allowance for use on food, travel or as you see fit - Free use of school bikes and e-bikes to explore the local area and get around - 3 free Chinese language and culture lessons a week - Invitations to family dinners, festivals and cultural events - Tours of the local areas, caves, mountains, lakes and hiking routes - Full \"awake hour\" translation and travel assistance by phone and Skype so you never have to worry about getting lost in translation! - Lots of other small random stuff, meals on the weekends, 2 days off a week, full teacher training, all work materials paid for, the list goes on and on... Who are we looking for? We are looking for bright, talented and imaginative people to come and be apart of our team. You need to be outgoing, fun and ready to create work off your own back, we want to really make a difference and need people who have the same drive and belief to help us achieve this! How do we pay for this? We are a self-funded non-profit, we do this through asking those who can afford our education services (students and partnership schools) to make set donations to us, this enables us to then provide for those who can’t afford it, as well as give funding to our other projects. As such all roles require a minimum of 1-2 days English teaching a week in order to allow us to both fund the projects and enable volunteers to have a great time. If you’d like to learn more about how we fund ourselves in more detail then please CONTACT US with any questions you may have. ​ How long can I stay? Lengths of stay vary depending on what time you would like to commit, most of our positions require a minimum stay of at least 3-6 months due to the type of projects we are looking to carry out and the commitment we have to provide to them. If you are unsure you are able to commit to this length of time then please let us know in your application and for those who want to stay for a while, we are have had people volunteer with us for years.
10025.title: Education, Urban-Farming & Recycling volunteers needed for ambitious project in China!

10023.description: Volunteers are needed for the 25th Annual New York City Terry Fox Run benefitting Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Cancer. The run/walk will take in Central Park on Saturday, October 13. We need folks to direct our participants on the run/walk course, and offer them lots of cheers and encouragement.
10023.title: Please join us on Saturday, October 13 for the New York City Terry Fox Run benefiting Memorial

10023.description: We are looking for volunteers in the following areas! Food Table 7:30am - 10:00am - NEED 2 Registration Help 7:30am - 9:00am - NEED 5 Course Marshals (help on the course) 8:50am - 10:00am - NEED 4
10023.title: Get Your Rear In Gear - New York 5k Run/Walk

10023.description: The Volunteer Referral Center and Health Advocates for Older People invite you to attend an information program designed for Volunteers of All Ages! Learn why organizations want you and how to get started. Meet and talk with volunteer directors from a variety of non-profit agencies. Where: Rutgers Presbyterian Church, 236 West 73rd Street BY BUS: Cross Town M72 to Broadway BY SUBWAY: 1, 2, 3, to 72nd St When: Tuesday, November 8, 2018 2:30 - 4:00 pm Admission is free Light refreshments RSVP: call 2 12-889-4805 or sign-up at http://volunteer-referral.com/volunteering-is-ageless-november-8-2018-230-400-pm/
10023.title: Volunteering is Ageless - November 8, 2018

10023.description: Centro NYC seeks dedicated volunteers with a passion for intercultural exchange and learning who can be available weekday evenings to ensure the smooth running of our ESL and Spanish programming at our new home near Lincoln Center. Core responsibilities: -Greeting students and managing class check-in, as well as new student registrations -Facilitating nightly break sessions between classes, by preparing/breaking down snack preparations, managing snack sales, and encouraging students to practice language skills -Participating in major marketing initiatives for the organization -Preparing monthly 'Intercambio' events - student mixers -Admin office tasks such as assisting teaching staff, checking voicemails and returning calls Commitment: Volunteers will be expected to meet either Tuesdays, Wednesday OR Thursday evenings from 6:00-9:00pm beginning Thursday September 20th and ending on Thursday, December 20th. If time constraints exist, there may be flexibility around start/end times for shifts. Eligibility: Foreign language experience a plus. How to apply: Email us at info@centronyc.org or apply through our volunteer form online. About us: Centro NYC (El Centro de Educación de Trabajadores) has provided a place of community and assistance for recent immigrants in New York City since 1975. Learn more about us at centronyc.org and facebook.com/CentroNYC2018/ Volunteers find a real sense of community at Centro, often staying for many years, and bringing their friends, family, and coworkers to join too. Volunteers themselves are welcome to take any class offered free of charge.
10023.title: Administrative/Operations Volunteer

10023.description: Hola! Somos una organizacion sin fines de lucro que ayuda a la comunidad inmigrante latina y no latina de Nueva York en el aprendizaje del idioma ingles, en la preparacion para el examen de ciudadania estadounidense y en el desarrollo de otras actividades de empoderamiento para la comunidad inmigrante. Tambien ofrecemos clases de espanol para no hispanohablantes, con lo cual contribuimos ademas a la difusion de la cultura y valores hispanos en los Estados Unidos. Estamos a la busqueda de profesores de Espanol (voluntarios) para nuestras clases de Otono 2018 (septiembre 20 - diciembre 20 2018). Las clases son una vez por semana (jueves) de 6:00 pm a 9:00 pm. Esta es una posicion de voluntariado (sin pago). Si te gusta ayudar a la gente y a la comunidad por favor comun?cate con nosotros respondiendo este aviso. Habra una sesion de entrenamiento previo al inicio de clases fecha tentativa. Muchas gracias!
10023.title: CentroNYC Spanish Teacher Volunteer

10023.description: Hola! Somos una organizacion sin fines de lucro que ayuda a la comunidad inmigrante latina y no latina de Nueva York en el aprendizaje del idioma ingl?s, en la preparaci?n para el examen de ciudadania estadounidense y en el desarrollo de otras actividades de empoderamiento para la comunidad inmigrante. Tambien ofrecemos clases de espanol para no hispanohablantes, con lo cual contribuimos ademas a la difusion de la cultura y valores hispanos en los Estados Unidos.
